Reviews.Title: “Magnificent common parts, but...”
Reviews.Author: pasomaje
Reviews.Content: Room at the first floor: - small, for instance, the table carrying the TV had to stand in front of one of the wardrobe’s doors, allowing it to open only halfway - dark since giving on an inner courtyard, which , in return, made it a very quiet room, at least as long as there were no guests on the terrace below - the furniture is outdated and battered, made of dark oak with rather coarse carvings - bathroom: large and all in marble, it displays a certain charm of bygone days If I had seen the room beforehand, I would never have booked it at that price, it was a deception. Breakfast: - Continental Buffet: 38€, for a hot beverage, bread, french cakes and a juice. Ham, cheese, yoghurt and fruit are extras, or else you choose the American Buffet at 49€ - a waitress, lacking the class that could be expected, didn’t shrink from arguing with us and even showing her annoyance, if not resentment

Reviews.Title: “A refurbishment is needed soon...”
Reviews.Author: david_bain5
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Crillon is a beautiful hotel on a wonderful part of Paris. The lobby, restaurant and bar are evocative of the mid to late 18th century, the period of the great, if sometime infamous French kings, Louis XV and XVI, when the building housing the hotel was built. So it has a sense of place and history that is sometimes missing in many five star hotels in the 21st century – that is to be applauded. But is this enough to compensate for the very high prices for a room at one the city’s most expensive hotels? I would have said yes if they got all the other stuff right. Yes, the service was impeccable. But it’s the things at the margin that matter when your paying more than €600 a night. Like a bathroom that is clearly looking forlorn, with the taps not working brilliantly, the shower looking a bit out of date and not as good as hotels a quarter of the price. Carpets in the hallways were often tatty, needing replacements, some pipes in the courtyard were rusty…and the room service breakfast looked pretty fatigued. I wouldn’t be complaining if I was paying half the price, but again you want this to be special, very special and it wasn’t. I hear the hotel has recently been taken over by a Saudi prince. Perhaps a refurbishment is in store…it needs it, but not at the expense of its wonderful history and sense of place…

Reviews.Title: “Magical, Memorable, Hushed Elegance”
Reviews.Author: inveterate_itinerant
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crillon for my birthday in January 2012. The visit was absolutely magical, and memorable. This is a hotel that knows what it's doing. It's also one of the truly elegant hotels in Paris, but unlike some of its competition (such as the elegant hotel nearby whose name is more well-recognized), the Crillon has maintained a sense of hushed elegance, of old-money ease and charm that's more true elegance than gold-leaf glamour. True, it's pricey, but it's worth every euro. Not the least of which because you walk out the door and Place de la Concorde is at your feet. The G.M. Luc Delafosse and his staff made my visit extraordinary. I can't say enough of how nice it was to be recognized -- the staff knew me from day 1 -- my first experience was three nights, then I went back for another night.. Based on a great long weekend stay, I went back to the Crillon following our ski trip to the Alps. A special message for the concierge team, who really set us up for two wonderful dinners at low-key restaurants (I wanted low-key places those nights, and our tables were in the best spots of both restaurants, and these are popular places with locals). Another special message goes out to the reservations team, who were so on-hand and wonderful when setting me up for the stay on the way back through Paris. And a very special message for Mr. Delafosse for being so friendly, and accessible. Impressive all around. Upon returning to the hotel for that last night in Paris, I was immediately greeted by name: I felt at home. As they say in the Crillon, it's your home in Paris, and I really felt that was true (albeit an extraordinarily elegant, well-positioned home filled with history - but your home nonetheless!). If you're willing to splurge for a luxurious stay, definitely check out this magical spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not quite up to last visit”
Reviews.Author: SirGeorge61
Reviews.Content: Second stay here within a year but under different circumstances so am revisiting. I stayed this time with my wife and our daughter. We booked a De Luxe room as that was all that was possible with the extra bed but we were upgraded on arrival to an Executive. It was a big room with a large sitting area and lots of space for the extra bed. It also had a small dressing area and a large bathroom. I was on the first floor as last time by request on the side giving onto the side road and the room had very high ceilings. My daughter was given some very nice Crillon toys which made her stay very special. This was really well done and a huge plus for the hotel. Since my last visit they had finished the exterior works. The interior is as always, very elegant and immaculate. The room was perfectly clean and prepared. beds were very comfortable indeed, even my daughters camp bed. Room service was efficient and courteous and errors of which there were a few were corrected without fuss. We were never disturbed at night. The position if it suits you, is unbeatable. A few issues: The doormen are next to useless. they watch you walk through the narrow revolving doors with suitcases without ever offering to help. Even when you engage them they just smile and simply stand in a small group chatting amongst themselves. This didn't bother me on my last trip when I was travelling very light but you don't stand by and watch a woman with a suitcase without offering to help. This is in total contrast to a hotel like Claridges in London where you are besieged by doormen as you get out of the taxi who immediately remove anything that they think they can help with. They don't want to see their guests struggling as they enter the hotel. This is not to say that the doormen at the Crillon are impolite but they could do a lot better. We arrived at about 4pm and our room was not ready. We had to wait about half an hour and were given tea while we waited. Considering I was told very strictly to be out by 12.00 when we left, I found this a surprise and it was inconvenient as we wanted to change and do some shopping before dinner. Last time I stayed, I was given a huge bowl of fresh fruit each day. This seems to have stopped which is a shame as it makes the room look better and was delicious. Maybe times are getting tough even at this end of the market. A huge black mark - on the last morning when I had a meeting I found that I had no water coming out of the hot tap. I had run the bath but it was cold. After a while water arrived but it was still cold and yellow in colour. I had no option but to have a cold bath. They came to fix it but it was too late. I was told that all the other rooms had no problem so I suppose it was an airlock. Later on I had a message to say that they were cutting the water supply at lunch time but we had checked out by then. On check out I mentioned it and I received only a sympathetic shrug. I offered the fact that I had just had a beer from the mini bar but even given the opportunity to give me the beer as a concession to my discomfort, he went to great pains to reprint the bill with the beer added. Maybe I'm being fussy but in my mind hot water in a hotel room is next to a bed in importance. It didn't make my hectic morning any easier. Anyway we had a good stay apart from the above and I still recommend the Hotel de Crillon as a wonderful place to stay in Paris at the top end.

Reviews.Title: “From perfect to lousy”
Reviews.Author: Betschart-CH
Reviews.Content: The quality varies very much. On the positive side there is a waitress in the breakfast room who still knows what guests were served the day before. On the negative side, at lunch bread was served to the meal without a separate plate for the bread, without butter and without a separate knife for the butter and where I had to ask for pen to sign the bill (and I don't want to desribe the pen I was given). The electronics in the hotel (TV, WLAN, etc.) would be excellent - if it worked. On the positive side, I was asked 3x to excuse the delay when checking out (no problem, it can happen); on the negative side, the guys at the conciergerie and at the entrance could definitely improve.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Magic”
Reviews.Author: Christophe P
Reviews.Content: Always first class service and accomodation in the very best location. : impressive decor, lovely staff, great food. Anyone who loves Paris and can afford it should try to stay there at least once in a lifetime.For those who can't, try to enjoy the restaurants or the beautiful "jardin d'hiver" tea room.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: WorldBusinessCO
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of weeks ago at the Hôtel De Crillon. I wanted to try, once in my life, this hotel in Paris. Location is great and the "french touch" is amazing. However, I was very surprised by the way I was welcomed by a lady at the check-in. Very rude and cold. She is probably the manager of the front desk because all the staff was runing everywhere and she kept saying things to them in french. That was not very profesionnal! Despite this inconvenience, the rest of the stay was nice. The staff was friendly and the breakfast very good. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best Hotel my wife and I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sodesa
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Crillon exudes old world refinement and elegance. The service is attentive and efficient throughout without being obtrusive. We were most impressed that housekeeping had painstakingly packed and folded our personal effects as part of their routine cleaning the rooms.We were also impressed that the staff managed to give us an early checkin before 11am in the morning The breakfast room is particularly opulent. The rooms are well fitted out from the dimmers from the ceiling chandeliers, to the rain showers in the bathrooms. Whilst the location is well positioned within proximity of Place Concorde and Vendome, it is perhaps less convenient to shopping and museums. Overall a memorable experience and raises the bar for Hotels everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Elegance”
Reviews.Author: I_am_a_Washingtonian
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was greeted with my first "Bonjour!" by the dashing porters outside the grand entrance, with its unbeatable view of the Place de la Concorde, I was sold-- hook, line and sinker. Why was my stay at Crillon so fabulous? * Restaurant and bar area: I felt like an extra in some classic French film, surrounded by such gorgeous chandeliers and attentive waiters. * Rooms: emanate European class. A sumptuous bed; super spacious walk-in closet; highest-quality curtains; very welcome iPod dock and flat-screen TV; sparkling bathroom with double sink, separate relaxing bathtub, rainforest shower, and two cozy cotton bathrobes. Fresh rose and fruit a thoughtful touch. * Concierge: in particular the gentleman from Bretagne-- wins top points for making numerous dinner reservations and answering many a Paris question, each time with a smile. * Check-in: makes immediate first-rate impression given that you are ushered to your own little sitting area and given hot tea served in silver. * Exercise facility: nice and modern with cardio machines featuring: individual screens, a wide choice of television stations, and an iPod dock; fruit, ample towels and water were just-what-I-needed additions. * In sum: an expertly-managed, impeccably classy hotel that 100% met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very impresive hotel in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: fergus67
Reviews.Content: Really fabalous hotel.You are in pure luxury from the moment you arrive at entrance.dining room is fabalous and it is where breakfast was served each morning .This is a really great hotel and hopefully will return.

Reviews.Title: “The best location. No pretentions. Class.”
Reviews.Author: ghvisitors
Reviews.Content: The Crillon is not the most modern, not the best equipped, not the best value, but it is the best spot, most classy spot to enjoy central Paris from. Not just a suited business visitor this time, but turning up with a teenage son in tow during half term break, the hotel gave its usual warm welcome and without without hesitation gave us a more suitable room with plenty of space and excellent modern bathroom. Conceirge had Louvre tickets to hand to avoid the queue and she fixed the requested lunch table for us despite short notice at sought after address (people don't value enough these well connected teams in the best hotels), confirming to me by phone while we were with the Mona Lisa. No taxis required to reach Place Vendome, Rue St Honore, Tuileries and Champs Élysées. Breakfast around the corner at Laduree on Rue Royale recommended - I'm afraid the Crillon, as many today, assume their guests will breakfast in house at uncompetitive rates. Bags of style and not at all pretentious. Despite the new openings this great city, Crillon offers much.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Oozing Wealth & Wonderment”
Reviews.Author: LuxurySpeaks
Reviews.Content: My one and only visit to the Crillion was almost a fairytale experience, suffering only from my lack of fluency in French. 30 years ago, pregnant and madly in love, the regal surroundings seemed the elevate the enchantment found so readily with Paris in the springtime. I almost expected Maurice Chevalier in the lounge but mon dieu! was not to be. In the heart of the Place de la Concorde, one can (and should) walk to every meaningful, storied venue in the immediate 'neighborhood' - an understated description of this part of the City. Even then, the astounding history and architecture of the property spoke more clearly than the appointments in the room, which with very little effort, could have made the visit flawless. As it was, the service of the entire staff and the central location of this property recommends it -- at least once--on a visit to the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris hotel of your dreams”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: This is not the Paris hotel I can stay in often, but was a wonderful one-time experience over 34 years of visiting Paris. Of course, the location is spectacular, the building and history gorgeous, the rooms nice (but a little dated), the public areas beautiful, but the exceptional service is what sets it apart. Attentive, responsive service from all levels of the staff make every guest feel just as important as the next and as you would like. Brunch in the gorgeous Les Ambassadeurs and tea in the Winter Garden were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Beetsdc
Reviews.Content: This is the quintessential French hotel. Gracious, impeccable service. Location on the storied Place de la Concorde. Beautiful public rooms, delicious food and wonderful room service. Our only disappointment was the configuration of the room/s. We had 4 small rooms - much like French apartments - that made us feel confined. Nothing like the spacious one room deluxe rooms pictured on their website.We asked to be moved to one room but that never happened. Maybe it's just the 5th floor. We will go back but only if we can have one spacious room, not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jorge911
Reviews.Content: I went in mid summer and the service was truly impeccable. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous that were filled with that "French" tradition, not to mention the consistency of the rooms. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful (not to mention the lobby and les ambassadeurs-which was by far one of the best restaurants in Paris). In my opinion, it is better than the ritz, and better than the George V, which is beautiful as well but doesn't have that same authenticity that the Crillon has. Truly an amazing hotel that really consists of pure luxury.

Reviews.Title: “sad to say...”
Reviews.Author: absarthou
Reviews.Content: good points first --- fantastic location and grand decor and helpful staff. rooms - tired and dated, faucets faulty and hard to use. we booked this hotel under our tablet membership and just assumed that everything would be alright. stayed from the 28th december 2011 to the 4th of jan 2012. got a confirmation from tablet but was unable to print our confirmation which stated our benefits. benefits as tablet member included 1/ welcome drinks which was not offered and 2/ free room upgrade which when we mentioned it, was offered at an additional cost of EUR 400/night (what?!) emailed tablet feedback on these whilst we were still staying at the hotel and the hotel tried to make up for it by giving us a nice bottle of wine and fruits. we had afternoon snack at the winter garden and noticed an error on the billing. that same afternoon we informed them so that they could give us the correct billing. good thing we reviewed our bill upon check-out, because the billing was not actually corrected. we had to wait on the spot for them to get this done. there are other "small" issues of which I am tired of already, having communicated these with tablet and the hotel to which we only got a response today after three (3) weeks. a few important tips : 1/ if booking through a partner program make sure you ask for your benefits upfront, it appears that some of their staff are not fully aware of these. I still feel that we were mislead - membership benefit mentioned free upgrade NOT an optional upgrade at a cost. to be offered one at an additional cost of EUR 400/night is misleading! 2/ always check your bill...especially before you check out, minor errors can add up. 3/ if you want to make sure your room is cleaned up when you return at an odd hour, say 4pm, ring them to tell them. otherwise you may find that your room is still at the same state you left it. it saddens me to write this review but this experience is a first, in terms of disappointment, for us in any of the hotels we have stayed at, so far. perhaps we expected too much? it's THE CRILLON after all!

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to move in”
Reviews.Author: PatienceSydney
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending six marvelous nights at this wonderful hotel to celebrate my wedding anniversary and I was not disappointed. The location and ambience of the hotel are second to none but the staff and their friendly "can do attitude" made our stay very special. We had breakfast in the gilded halls of Les Ambassadeurs every morning and on the day of our anniversary were treated to champagne and the best pain perdu I have ever eaten. On another afternoon fresh strawberries and rose champagne appeared miraculously in our room. The metro line is right outside the hotel and some of Paris's finest attractions are at your doorstep. I emailed the Concierge prior to my visit to make some restaurant bookings and he also recommended a very good restaurant for our last night in Paris. Afternoon tea in the Wintergarden was also a treat. My only suggestion would be some muesli for the breakfast buffet as a healthy alternative to the delicious pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Goes beyond the norm!!!”
Reviews.Author: SueRVirginia
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel and the staff there. My daughter was starting a four month stay in Paris for a study abroad program and we came a week early and stayed at the Hotel de Crillon. Despite everyone telling us to stay at another 5 star hotel (you can figure out which) we chose to stay there because of a recommendation from American Express. I can only say Thank God we did. The hotel is beautiful, the service excellent and attentive, the location is excellent, and we experienced only the best of food there. However, what made it go beyond the expected 5 star was that they made the impossible happen. After viewing what we thought was a fully furnished apartment in an outskirts of Paris on Sunday afternoon where she needed to stay that night, (I was leaving the next morning early) I became anxious because it had not one sheet, towel, pillow or blanket in it. I asked several people who said stores were closed on Sunday I became really frantic. We raced back to the hotel and I presented myself to the wonderful concierge, Sarah and said "Please make the impossible happen" and she did. Not only did she arrange a car and driver to come in 30 minutes, she found the place, called the place and wrote down the names of the items we would need in French. She also found a small food store nearby where we could purchase some staples and called them to tell them what we needed and to have it ready. I can only say that I owe the Hotel de Crillon a tremendous amount for giving a mother the peace of mind to leave her daughter in a safe and comfortable environment in a foreign country. I plan to visit Paris often over the next few months and would never dream of staying any place else. So if you want the impossible to happen stay here, you won't regret it for a minute!

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: OR55
Reviews.Content: high price but still less than ritz and 4 seasons and in the same class service fom all personal was amazing rooms are very clean but decor a bit heavy and old

Reviews.Title: “Great but not as convincing as we'd expect”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaBrussels
Reviews.Content: Went to Hotel de Crillon a few times in 2011, always during the day, for brunch and for drinks. There is excellent service, with that Parisian flair and elegance, worthy of 5-star hotels in the city. However there was always that little thing missing or that little hiccup that didn't quite convince. For example, the brunch, although pricey, is not as good as we'd expect it to be. In fact it was rather simple. And my chair was rocking. I had to ask for it to be replaced. Coffee and desserts are delicious but a 10 euro chocolate cake was tiny. The hotel seems to be under endless renovations and its facade has been under reconstruction for what seems like ages. Not sure if we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frequent T
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old palace in a very convenient location on Paris. Loved the wonderful and elegant Christmas Decoration. Can only recommend to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth every penny. We had a superb weekend. The restaurants were amazing, the ambience luxurient and the staff very friendly. We were treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Leading Hotel of the World”
Reviews.Author: Sciurus83
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister in December 2011 in the Hotel De Crillon. The Hotel itself is a gourgeous Palace on Place de la Concorde. The interior and the rooms reflect what you are expecting from a Palace Hotel from a century ago like the Hotel De Crillon. Everything is well renovated and up to a modern standard with flat screen TV, iPhone docking station and free WiFi. But that is what you expect anyway from a Leading Hotel of the World. Breakfast, drinks at the bar and afternoon tea are of a very good quality, but do not blow you away with something special. Noteworthy is the beautiful atmosphere of the restaurant where breakfast is served. What makes the Hotel De Crillon very special amongst other Hotels is the very good and personal service. Especially to mention are the friendly and charming guest relation manager Fiona and the two front desk ladies Daria and Stephanié as well as the very helpful and friendly concierge Patrick. They made our stay very pleasant. Thank you. To sum up, the Hotel De Crillon is a very good Hotel to stay while you are in Paris and provides everything you expect from a 5* Hotel. In addition, you enjoy a perfect service at the well managed Hotel De Crillon. Such a service is hardly to find in another hotel in Europe. For that service you have to go to the Middle East or to Asia. Thank you for a great time in Paris / Merci beaucoup pour une virée superbe à Paris.

Reviews.Title: “hotel crillon remarkable”
Reviews.Author: grahamBarcelona
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience, friendly staff, extremely attentive. 5 star service 5 star price

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MCMELO
Reviews.Content: A stay unforgettable, full of kindness. An extraordinary and experienced staff. Without doubt the best hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best service of all Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AVPDOR
Reviews.Content: Under the new management of Mr. Delafosse, the service has been re-established! I have have stayed at the Crillon there three times this year and the service was impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: MeMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in October 2011. Reserved throught grandluxuaryhotels.com and received a guarenteed room upgrade. (Executive Room) Check-in was so very nice with one-on-one service while seated in the lounge. The young woman who assisted us was friendly, yet professional. (I HATE the "I'm your new best friend" approach that is invading the American service industry) Our room was large with a seating area (sofa, cocktail/coffee table & 2 chairs), large desk & chair and a king bed. The bed was ever so comfortable, but the sofa and chairs were like sitting on rocks. They were so uncomfortable, I would sit at the desk at night to read before bed. I would think a 5 star hotel would provide better. The bathroom almost made up for the poor seating (almost, but not entirely!) It had a double sink vanity with excellent lighting, a deep soaking tub with separate shower. A heated towel rack would have been a nice addition. Maid service exceeded excellence We received an abundance of large, fluffy white towels twice a day. We were provided with enough shampoo and hand lotion to open our own shop. I cannot say enough good things about these ladies. Breakfast was a delight each morning. It was so good to have eggs for breakfast after 15 days of pastry! On our first morning, our daughter asked our waiter what was the French word for spoon. Each succeeding morning, he would point to the spoon, fork and knife and wait for her to respond with the correct word in French. She would be rewarded with a bright smile and wink if correct or rolling of the eyes if incorrect. It was a fun way to start the day. Would I stay here again? No. But I would eat breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: matt b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Crillon for three nights and loved it. The service was great, the room was very nice and you can't beat the location. Only complaint is that it was unseasonably warm in Paris and the A/C in our room was less than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Oh So Lovely”
Reviews.Author: missnice2012
Reviews.Content: Everything was first class except for the pears. I had a costume party to attend and it fell apart. They had someone come and help me fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique...”
Reviews.Author: Lorenza M
Reviews.Content: Hi there....just joined here...Been a Crillon many times and the place is special....if you never been to Paris this is the best location to visit the city...rooms are wonderful and staff so friendly. Ill keep going to Crillon...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Steve_TravelRepublic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel de Crillon at the end of October for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. So restful and calm, away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris, yet right there at your feet when you step out! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: pennywestofscotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here recently and it really is a special place. Ideal in its location on the Place de la Concorde and Champs Elyseees. Beauiful decor to welcome you into the foyer. Our room wasnt ready on arrival in late afternoon but we were offered drinks in the bar to make up for our wait. It was a very nice touch and the gentleman who looked after us was very apologetic. The room was lovely, surprisingly spacious and with gorgeous Annick Goutal toiletries. Only one problem- Cant stay anywhere else in Paris now!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel and Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: micheal_k679
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved everything about Hotel De Crillon.! I cannot think of one aspect of the hotel I would change. The common areas are also beautifully decorated and comfortable. The staff was friendly, yet respective and extremely helpful. We booked this hotel through MY KIND OF VACATIONS (www.mykindofvacations.com) so all thanks to them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - if you like it the old fashioned way”
Reviews.Author: SRLDN
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for two nights at the de Crillon with my teenage daughter who is very hip, trendy, style and fashion conscious. We booked two Deluxe rooms, I got upgraded to an Executive room as they room I was first given must have been used by a smoker the previous day, I did not even have to ask for an upgrade but was offered it right away. Both rooms were impeccable, spacious and nicely decorated - if you like the classic style. We have stayed in many trendy and ultra modern 5 star hotels in the past but I do prefer the classic and elegant style of the de Crillon when staying in Paris, it just goes with the spirit of the city. My daughter loved the whole atmosphere and feel of the place. The service is impeccable, the staff friendly and helpful, never over the top but always there to help. You are treated like a guest. And if you make an effort to be nice, ie say good morning, how are you and have a friendly chat they will treat you like royalty. And yes, dressing properly helps, it's not a Las Vegas Jeans & sneaker hotel. I will always stay at the de Crillon from now on, it had such an authentic feel to it and it feels like home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: nancy2004_11
Reviews.Content: This was the last five star with availability. Now I see why. Please don't waste your money. No spa, no pool, joke for a gym. Charges for water. No chocolates. Stuffy service. Lots of NO! Went for lunch at 1:59 pm, we are closed at 2pm. Sorry go away. Iaid $6000 for five nights of this. NEVER AGAIN! Plus I found out the exchange everywhere else was 70 euro to $100. They were giving us 62 euro per 100 us. Got screwed on that rate as well. I hope one person e mails me to say I saved them the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - rooms average”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We always wanted to stay here due to the history and beauty of the hotel. The common areas are truly spectacular and the location excellent however the rooms don't justify the exorbitant price - quite small a bit tired although bathroom nice and bed comfortable. Room wasn't ready at check in time and turn down service interrupted a number of times despite do not disturb. Recommend meeting for high tea here - visit for experience but don't stay...

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm - First Class Service - Don't Forget the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KirkPA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3rd visit to the Crillon. This time 3 nights. The renovations seem to get a lot of negative attention in the reviews lately. We did not encounter any disruptions in the highest levels of service that the Crillon offers. Having stayed at many 5 star hotels, this is the one that we come back to when in Paris. The one thing that we have forgotten to put into the past reviews is that you MUST order the American breakfast in your room at least 1 morning. It is the perfect way to start a full day in the city. Remember, this is not a brand new hotel - it is a magnificent palace that had the great fortune of being turned into an amazing luxury hotel around the turn of the last century. If you want old world charm, uniqueness to each room and a staff that is caring and abundant - stay at the Crillon! We are real people from the states who like to get away and expect the best. Bon voyage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Newmoongirl
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely, bathroom was fantastic, service was good. We walked alot which was lovely in the parks at Autumn.

Reviews.Title: “Get your acts together Crillon”
Reviews.Author: Abricoss
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for the Crillon experience, so the disappointment was big. Above all the service was unhelpful, fakely polite and not 5star-standard. The size and beauty of the rooms were not nearing the level of an average 4 star. No one was able to get us a table at the hotel restaurant, and the concierge was so bad that he couldn't find us a table in another good restaurant. Crillon in NOT a 5 star hotel. Don't be duped because it is spoiled by its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deception”
Reviews.Author: FLSLE
Reviews.Content: Such a bad experience NEVER AGAIN ! Hotel is expensive but not at all up to their so called luxery standards. Rooms are very small, service is deplorable and check in at only 3.00pm is just not acceptable if you come from far or have a specific (helath) request.

Reviews.Title: “the grand dame of parisian hotels”
Reviews.Author: JandpD
Reviews.Content: Third visit for us thankfully the hotel de crillon has been spared the rather contrived modern parisian hotel makeover unlike the plaza athenee the georges cinq and the Ritz and always seems more palatial than Le meurice which is also superb. Les ambassadeurs is definitely in our top 5 of parisian restaurants and without doubt is in our opinion one of the most spectacular dining rooms in the world. The check in seated at an 18th century bureau plat and drinks in the beaufiful winter garden are unique experiences all in the hart of bustling paris. Breakfast is suberb especially the eggs benedict with truffle. The rooms are beautifully appointed with fresh flowers and orchids and have views of la place de la concorde the american embassy next door and rue de faubourg saint honore. Have seen reports it is for sale please do not fix what is not broken.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: Fabrice_75002
Reviews.Content: I've been there several times. Kindness of the staff, beautiful rooms... It makes you feel like you're home. Feel free to ask whatever you want. The luxury is hiding beyond lots of little details. Historical monument in Paris on one of the most beautiful place of the city. Seems a bit expensive but when you taste it, you sure want to go back. Just one little problem : you may experience little problem with the TV media system (pay per view), especially if you have a suite. I really don't know why. And check the A/C system as you enter into your room. Sometimes, there is a problem. But those are real details comparing to the amazing hotel The Crillon is.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury and outstanding service!!”
Reviews.Author: soszeus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crillon for 4 nights and really loved everything. My reservation was made by AMEX Platinum Prime Travel Tour and, for our surprise, we were triply up-graded, from a Superior Room to a Junior Suite, with champagne, strawberries and chocolate, very nice touch!!! We were also given some amenities as buffet breakfast + late check-out until 4pm + an afternoon tea for 2 + complimentary departing transfer to the airport. The hotel car (Mercedes) is also available to take you to nearby areas since early morning until 9:30pm (free of charge). On our arrival we were greeted by the doorman and escorted to the front desk where Kaori made our check-in kindly and all in smiles. After that she escorted us to our Suite and showed us everything inside. The Concierge guys were all great and helped me with promptness everytime I needed, they even got me a place to dinner at Le Jules Vernes (Eiffel Tower fine restaurant on 2nd level) on the same day I asked for (this is very difficult as this restaurant requires many days previous reservation). The hotel is in a perfect location on Place de la Concorde, right in the heart of Paris and close to everything. And if you like walking as we do you can go to the sightseeing places as the Tuileries, Louvre Museum, Notre Dame, Triumph Arc (on Champs-Elyseé) and even the Eiffel Tower (2,5 km from the hotel), just appreciating this wonderful city. But if you are not a walker like me you should take the subway to the Eiffel Tower. You are also close to the shopping hot spots like Champs-Elyseé, Saint-Honoré Street and Place Vendôme where you will find the finest brands. The hotel has 2 main restaurants, L'Obé and Les Ambassadeurs (the most beautiful) where we had our breakfast every morning. Breakfast has many food options including hot and cold buffet, all very tasteful. Hotel also offer The Bar where you can have some drinks and a Winter Garden (depending on weather conditions) where we had our afternoon tea, very nice too!! There is a fitness center on 6th floor with some apparels and water (take the elevator until 5th and walk up the stairs to 6th). You must use your room key to access the FC which is open 24h. I have no words to say how wonderful was my stay at Hotel de Crillon, this is my home in Paris from now on. A special thanks to Yulia Yarochkina who was my first contact at the hotel and assisted me all the time before my arrival, also to Kaori for her kindness and to Clement (the Swiss guy from Les Ambassadeurs), he's a very nice and funny guy. Also special thanks to Philipe, Serge and all the Concierge guys who assisted me in everything I needed during my stay, you were all great!! See you guys next time in Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Paris Fashion & luxury at best value for what you pay, so its beauty..”
Reviews.Author: butch54
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel few years back alone,,friends are their in Paris but I don't stay..I love luxury of hotels..Paris is known for fashion & arts of France. My visit was just to attend friends wedding.My initial plan was attend wedding & leave 2 days but because of the hotel & Paris city not paris hilton I stayed for a week.It was memorable experience,,great culture nice people same goes for the hotel staff, I booked suite known as historical initially for 2 days but when I asked to extend my stay manager corporated without any issues..They got deluxe rooms also as well as diff suites basically suites are same just few are bigger thats only difference. My suite was excellent huge spacious well decorated , not only well beautifully decorated suit..All basic amenities r their ..excellent staff bcz english speaking staff is hard to find in France...but here all understand & speak well english..The bar is excellent with french wines..to enjoy..& great restaurants 1 is open green restaurant beautiful ,,Les Ambassadeurs is best restaurant you can find in paris..Awesome you must check it to feel the taste of french cuisine..The other great thing abt hotel is u can get view of eiffiel tower frm ur window. At night whole hotel looks great nicely lightened.Well equipped gym is their boutique also..What u expect from 5 star hotel all is their..The hotel location is also perfect center of city...moral of story great hotel great restaurant best value for money ,,paris is not cheap city so I would say its reasonable price best in paris love to stay again ...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Crillon - Convenient - Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: GrannyJoan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Paris. We rented two adjoining Executive Suites at the Hotel Crillon in Paris. The rooms were very large, bathrooms were luxurious and the service outstanding. We ordered room service two mornings and the service was promptly delivered and setup. We used the consieurre to arrange travel arrangements to the airport on departure and were very pleased with the van and driver. The Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to some of the major attractions in Paris. We also used the hop off hop on bus for two days to see the major attractions. The bus stopped along the Champ de Elysse near the Grand Palace, from there we had a lovely walk in the park area to the hotel (15 to 20 minutes). We dined out most days at cafes in Paris. The Hotel also left lovely welcome surprises for our granddaughters upon our arrival. We enjoyed the stay at the Hotel Crillon and would definitely recommend it and stay here again. This hotel provided an authentic feel of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every way, but for one "inconvenience"”
Reviews.Author: Celebconsult
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Crillon a number of years ago and enjoyed every element of it... reception, suite accommodations and amenities, location and convenience to every place and all transportation venues, and a wonderful restaurant with some of our most memorable dining ever. The physical premises and interior decor are a museum. We did have one "inconvenience", however, which speaks to the splendor and quality of the de Crillon. Our reservations had been made about 4 months in advance, and we reconfirmed 4 weeks ahead. On arrival, however, with great regret, the Reception Manager apologized that our accommodations (and those of every other reserved guest for that night) could not be honored as available for that first night of our stay, "Because the King of Morocco has decided to extend his stay for an additional day, and he and his retinue are occupying almost every room in the hotel. We have made wonderful alternative accommodations for you for tonight, and we will bring you back tomorrow." All of which they did. So, I think if you can keep the guest Royals out of the room reserved for you, you'll always remember everything about your otherwise unique experiences at the Hotel de Crillon. GAM

Reviews.Title: “Luxury. Pure class. Very pricey”
Reviews.Author: Europesally
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my honeymoon August 2009. Penthouse apartment. Pure class. Luxury. Breakfast divine. Very expensive. Thought penthouse could have been much nicer bearing in mind it was 1000 per night. Our honeymoon suite in Dromoland castle (Ireland) was outstanding. Overall great experience. I loved every minute of my stay here. Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Waouh hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leonora M
Reviews.Content: My second home away from home ! Usually staying on a 5 night stay for business and enjoying high level of attention to details, upgrade, beautiful tailor-made amenities, Winter and Summer garden for teas and drinks. I love this place and can not stop recommending it - great location and so Parisian...well done all; great size of room, marble bathroom...so luxury!

Reviews.Title: “felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: cannbabes
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times and to me The Crillon has the best location in the city on the beautiful Place de la Concorde! There is something about driving up to this hotel that no other place in Paris can match. Common areas of the hotel are stunning and we enjoyed afternoon tea in the outdoor garden. We enjoyed walking behind the hotel to shop along Rue Honore-the famous Laduree is so close for macaroons. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstandingly Professional and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGarcon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Crillon is one of Paris's legendary "palace" hotels. The Crillon has a superb location on the Place de la Concorde, although the vast majority of the room are on the side street, rue Boissy d'Anglas. This is actually a good thing, as the Place de la Concorde has a lot of traffic noise while the rue Boissy d'Anglas has none, since the U.S. Embassy is on the other side, and no traffic is allowed for safety reasons. I have stayed at a few of the other Parisian palace hotels, including the Georges V and the Meurice. Both are also excellent, but I think what really sets the Crillon apart is that the service, while just as professional and outstanding as those other hotels, is so friendly and personable. Paris has a reputation for snooty and haughty service, but you will not find any of that at the Crillon, which has more the feel of a terrifically pampering luxury home. We reserved a junior suite and were upgraded to a superior suite with the American Express Fine Hotel & Resorts program. The room was gorgeous, luxurious and extremely comfortable. And while it was clearly not a cheap stay, I felt we received excellent value, worth every penny. Overall, I would have to say this is my favorite luxury hotel in Paris, and I plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous suite”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: Only complaint was no view, but complimentary champagne and roses in our one bedroom suite a nice touch. Splendid location, fab restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: littlemissnaughty28
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a block away, less than 3 min walk to Hermes and FSH Opposite 3 star restaurant Le Meurice. Short walk to Pierre Herme at Rue Cambon. Taxi from CDG airport was €40. Saw a metro in front of hotel. Attentive n great service. Rooms nothing to shout about though..

Reviews.Title: “Good, but customer service is not great”
Reviews.Author: NatalieSmith
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel, but you would expect a bit more. I think it all comes down to lack of that superior customer service that you get at US hotels. Most of the staff was very nice, especially at breakfast buffet service, but there were flaws in other areas of dining, it seems to be not about the personnel, but they just needed to be adequately trained, for example to acknowledge a guest who comes into the bar area and offer the menu instead of completely ignoring their presence. And connecting rooms had BAD isolation, we could hear our neighbors laughing and talking word to word, because there is a connecting door.

Reviews.Title: “a place to stayfor an unforgettable Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2010
Reviews.Content: The best, elegant, charming, discreet. It is like staying in a museum with all the comfort and incredible view! Service is what you would expect from this level of hotel, impeccable. The minisuite we were given was large and very comfortable with a small terrace with an incredible view of the Tour Eiffel, what could you wish more? the bottel of Chablis and the fruit left in the room to welcome us were exquisite. Bar and restaurant are magnificent. Not sure you can find what you get here in other hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of good service”
Reviews.Author: PBCLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of this stunning hotel, which is being renovated, is hard to better. The staff are charming and helpful, and a highlight is the breadth of choice and quality of the breakfast in the most elegant of dining rooms. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel minus the renovations”
Reviews.Author: avandane
Reviews.Content: Would have been a great stay if it wasn't for the thumping of the renovation machinery. Was told at reception we would not hear anything. Not true. Stayed the one night then moved to Plaza Athenee, where service is impeccable and no issues with noise. Sorry Hotel Crillon, but you really need to watch where you place guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare in Paris - Hotel de Crillon Under Construction!!!!!!! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: ashley041
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our teenage daughter to Paris this last June. We had a wonderful time exploring the capitol cities in Europe until we reached Paris. We arrived at the Hotel de Crillon and immediately noticed it was under construction - the entire facade of the building was covered with scaffolding. The formally charming patio is now covered with astro turf -can you believe it? Once the epitome of Parisian style and grace, it now presents as a stop for tour buses. The hotel should be closed during this extensive renovation!!! Let's hope they hire someone with some aesthetic sensibility and taste, not leave it to the person who laid down astro turf. We checked in and they had upgraded our room. What a joke!!! When we saw it, we thought they were kidding. The room was small and tight with low ceilings and was not well appointed. Throughout Europe, we had been upgraded and had wonderful accommodations........ but not here. We had stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and our 10th anniversary and now our 20th. We asked to be upgraded to the suite we had last time (which was available) but they refused and told us it would cost $5,000 for this room per night. We viewed the suite and it had not changed in the last 10 years - it was tired and run down and smelled of cigar smoke. We tried to see if we could get a better deal because $5,000 per night was a crazy price for it. The hotel refused to budge at all and only offered us a bottle of champagne if we took the room at their very, very inflated price. Our past experience at the Crillon had been completely different - the staff was much more accommodating and willing to upgrade. We found the current staff pompous, stingy and rude. Their concierge was insufferably rude - he went out of his way to insult me and give me bad advice. We ended up staying in this horrible little room overlooking a very noisy side street as we couldn't change hotels. Oh, did I mention that the shower had black mold in it and leaked. Also, the construction noise and truck deliveries started at the crack of dawn and went on all day- we didn't sleep a wink. We tried so very hard to move hotels but it was the Paris Air Show that week and all the other comparable hotels were booked. We learned that the Crillon had been sold since we had last stayed there and the management company had changed as well. All this ruined our trip to our favorite city in the world. I would never, ever stay at this hotel again. BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL, ITS HORRIBLE SEVICE, AND INCREDIBLY HIGH PRICES AND NOT TO MENTION ALL THE CONSTRUCTION!!!!!!!!! The ownership and management should be replaced with people qualified to own and operate a property of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “We love our stay at the Crillon.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: A last minute decision to change hotel after arriving in Paris with my two teenage daughters on the weekend before the Bastille Day, as Paris is at full capacity. We stayed at the Park Hyatt-Vandome on our last visit and are familiar with this area, as our agent informed us that both the Park Hyatt and Ritz are full, our agent was able to book us a room at the Crillon, this was our first stay at the Crillon, and it saved our vacation. The Crillon is designed in magnificent classic French style with walls of marble and mirrors in the dining areas, beautiful chandeliers and bouquets of roses throughout the property, and comfortable chairs and tables for relaxing or small gatherings. It is centrally located facing the Concorde, and walking distance to all the major museums and attractions. Only a 5 minute walk to my favorite deli, "Fauchon" (next to the Madeleine). Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite that opens up to a large balcony with a table and chairs that over look the street. Although the building's front entrance was under some renovation, we did not hear any noises from the construction at all. The staff were friendly and attentive to our every need. We had breakfast in the Les Ambassadeurs each morning, had tea in the afternoon, and one night had a few local friends over to the Bar Crillon for a bottle of wine. Everything we had in this hotel was excellent, the food, the wine selection, the accommodation, and down to the daily replenishment of our fruit tray and the flower in our room. We felt like royalty, living in a beautiful castle with all the modern amenity. The concierge was friendly and helpful, definitely use their services for booking restaurants or just for directions or suggestions. When traveling abroad, a good concierge can be your best friend- definitely use their services. All in all, our stay at the Crillon surpassed my expectations, I now would prefer the Crillon over Park Hyatt-Vandome and the Ritz, when staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “300 euro was stolen by house keepers”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_tangjitsatukij
Reviews.Content: my friends left his wallet in the room before went out for lunch. when he returned, he found out that his money was stolen for 300 euro. (we counted it before we left) then they decided to check out and move to Sofitel nearby.. Hotel paid no serious action to this case. the rest of the hotel are fantastic...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Coucoubanana
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect- its walking distance to almost every point of interest and it is a fantastic location for shopping. It is round the corner from rue de st honore and 5min walk to montaigne. I was afraid that the hotel would be abit snobbish as the french reputation preceeds them but the concierge and reception were polite even thoughh we looked like kids and were helpful with our request. Our room was quiet and there was a double door so you could not hear the other guest walking in the hallway, but you could hear the neighbours through the bathroom. I wished the hotel had provide complimentary bottles of water like all the big hotels but the free wifi was better. I am looking forward to staying there next year when i visit paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and exterior but less than stellar thereafter.”
Reviews.Author: NNS214
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many nicer hotels and this was definitely not one of the better ones. Started out by our room not being ready when we got there so we left our bags and asked for them to be placed in our room when we got back. We asked when we returned if they were in our room and the desk attendant said yes. We went up to our room and no the bags were not there. When we called back down they were apparently "lost". How that happens in a boutique hotel not sure. They did find them shortly thereafter but definitely not what you expect at a place of this caliber. That was our start and we stayed for 4 nights and there were many other snafus along the way including my and my wife's room keys being deactivated at the same time. When we went downstairs the lady went back through our information and it was obvious they had entered the wrong check out date. Rooms and halls are dated and small. It has great potential but needs updating and something to help with the organization because ultimately that's where the problems lie. Also it is really for an older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Crillon and it is our home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeslieYork
Reviews.Content: This the perfect hotel for my husband who has difficulty walking great distances and enjoys the care of a fine hotel. There are other fine hotels in Paris but most have large public areas and the distance to your room can be very long. We love the care and attention we receive at The Crillon and their winter garden room for cocktails is one of the most beautiful rooms I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “The most gracious accommodations in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Santa_Fe_Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: We simply adore this place and would not stay anywhere else. The location is ideal. The rooms charming. Pay for a suite and you will not be disappointed. The staff could not have been more gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Still the same old-fashioned style”
Reviews.Author: AS71
Reviews.Content: Crillon is one of my worldwide favorites with number of stays on record. We stayed there recently with my wife after about a year brake. Still the same old fashioned Crillon. Almost no personnel changes. Still queues for breakfast ( though efforts are taken to increase the table numbers). Still very different rooms to please or to discourage depending on your luck and persistence. A bit of arrogance in all the concierge and other services. Be prepared to things that I considered normal some years ago and that are now become to be lesser acceptable. For example we ask to book a restaurant being outside of the hotel and asked to send us SMS message with the name and address due to bad line. Concierge told he cannot do that. After I insisted he said he would try and of course never did it. We had to call him repeatedly and finally he gave us restaurant close to pereferique and really empty on busy Saturday eve. Was it his intention? Rooms of Crillon are generally well kept but need un update. What I really like in Crillon is their bar. This is very well run and efficient evening experience. In general I still like Crillon and it is still on my favorites lists. But believe that it should make a significant effort to create "an easy service feeling" that is now very important companion to the top quality hotel experience. This is not possible to do without personnel approach and people changes. Overall service level in Crillon is very much depending on the particular person that you are talking to as well as his or her peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieTay
Reviews.Content: A surprise treat did not disappoint! Absolutely amazing. The doormen were gorgeous and always had a smile for me, the concierge got the job done quickly and pleasantly and the hotel was wonderful to look at. All staff were so very personal, helpful and genuine. I never wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from their restaurants and enjoy concierge services”
Reviews.Author: AninhaRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: I've made a reservation at the Hotel using Amex platinum concierge services. The hotel stays in an excellent location, close to the metro, restaurants (don't miss Buddha Bar) and luxury shops. The room is comfortable, marble bathroom with delicious Annick Goutal amenities. Concierge services are outstanding, reception staff is also nice and efficient. My point of disgusting is restaurant service/staff. Inattentive, slow, an inadmissible service, in despite of the overpriced menu. It took 20 min to get a glass of water during breakfast, although I've asked for it twice. I think I shouldn't even have to ask for it once! They offered some dishes from the kitchen (such as omelet, sausages), but after ordering a white omelet, I had to wait 40 min! They've apologized, saying the kitchen was too busy... at 10 am (imagine lunch or dinner...). The service was a little bit better in Ambassadeur, but still too slow (too long gaps between dishes).

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: jolynm
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel in a gorgeous spot...you're right across from the louvre, at the place de la concorde...it's a beautiful hotel with wonderful service...

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to get there”
Reviews.Author: markana
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say thank you to everyone who has posted a review of this magnificent hotel. My wife and I are yet to arrive, booked for October during fashion week, but since we have been waiting about 5 years to return to Paris and visit this beautiful hotel I just couldn't wait to post something. We first saw the Hotel de Crillon on our first day in Paris whilst walking up to the Champs-Elysees and immediately fell in love with it and have been dreaming about staying there ever since. Reading the reviews people have graciously posted since has only made matters worse. LOL Can't wait to get there.

Reviews.Title: “My Desolation”
Reviews.Author: NoSnakesPlease
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I learned that if you break your foot in Milan, you can't take the TGV night train back to Paris and stay at the splendid Hotel de Crillon so you can write authentically about it in your novel. All you can do is hobble onto a plane and fly home, your heart broken. How I longed to sleep where Marie Antoinette took piano lessons, only to later be beheaded outside in the square. Desolate, I browse the other reviews. I will return, Hotel de Crillon. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional attention even before arrival...”
Reviews.Author: travelPAJ
Reviews.Content: It seems to be the norm that when a hotel reservation is made an automated response is received acknowledging your reservation, thanking you and a ‘we look forward to seeing you soon’ signature. This is the norm. Hotel de Crillon is anything but the norm. After having made my reservations for an upcoming visit the hotel inquired as to my needs and if there was any special reason for my visit. I informed them that I was visiting to celebrate a special birthday and immediately they organized a cake and inquired at what point during the stay would this be best. I was also contacted by the head concierge, I replied inquiring about restaurants he could recommend for molecular cuisine to which I received a reply worthy of being published in a food journal which went as far as to include the background and training for the chefs involved. The attention and service I have so far received from the hotel is such that even though I have yet to arrive I must share my experience. The concierge has gone as far as attempting to secure incredibly difficult reservations that require that one go online to a particular website at a given date and time. Truly the mark of a great hotel is the ability to make the guest feel special and to fulfill all of the guests desires and expectations, with nothing being considered too extreme, outrageous or difficult. It is this that sets a true grand-dame of a hotel apart from all the rest. A famous food critic once said when asked what his favorite restaurant was “the one where I am known,” well, while I have yet to arrive to the Crillon, I truly feel known and welcomed. I look forward to posting again after my return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be better”
Reviews.Author: HansenDenmark50
Reviews.Content: You can get it different - but not better. Maybe The Ambassadeaurs has only one star at the moment. But... And the hotel can't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: chestermax
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel knowing it was special but we weren't prepared for how lovely it was. We found all staff very helpful, not intrusive with just the right amount of contact. It was my birthday whilst we were there. They delivered to our room a letter from the manager, a bottle of champagne and a delicious cake it was a lovely surprise and a wonderful touch, Thank You Monsieur Herman . Breakfast was a highlight. There was so much food on offer with wonderful flavours. Nothing was too much trouble and a particular mention to Edith who made us feel very special at breakfast. We often ended our nights in the bar which was also a great experience. I could not fault one thing with Hotel de Crillon it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: ThamyresVM
Reviews.Content: Very sophisticated hotel, big and equipped rooms and amazing breakfast with the best of french pastry

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated & NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: MarsieGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an 8 day stay in Paris (four nights at Le Crillon) for a special anniversary trip. Let me first say that the Concierge staff at Le Crillon was wonderful. The location of the hotel was also superb. Upon arrival, we were greeted in our room with a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit -- very lovely and much appreciated. The room was traditionally decorated, ornate, very old world French. The bed, however, was not comfortable--seemed past its prime.....had two depressions where people had slept. The love seat in the room was stiff, shallow and also not very comfortable. We were not shown the thermostat controls and consequently was too cold the first night. The worst part of the stay, however, was the fact that the head of our bed was positioned against the wall to the marble lined hallway which was not carpeted. You could hear every person walking with any heel at all hours of the day or night. To make matters worse, our room was at the end of the hall near where Pacco Rabanne was setting up for their Fashion Week showroom....at 2am! We heard every worker walking up and down the hallway with their noisy carts and chit chat. My husband got up the first night to see what was going on and asked people to be more quiet. When he called down to the front desk, no one was around. When he tried to speak to the manager the next morning, the manager apologized but made no attempt to rectify the situation. He did not offer to change our room. He made no assurances that it would not happen again. It did. It was apparent to us that they cared more about renting their meeting rooms during Fashion Week than the comfort of their guests. When checking out, we were honest about our unpleasant accomodations. They attempted to make us an offer to return to the hotel, but we were not interested in returning to Le Crillon. They took our email address, but after one week, we have not heard from the Hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable weekend”
Reviews.Author: billymax
Reviews.Content: - this hotel is very hard to fault if you're simply looking for luxury ,excellent service , pampering and to be thoroughly spoilt in one of the best locations in Paris. Our superior room on the second floor was large and very well appointed and although we found the bed a little uncomfortable the linens were excellent , the soft furnishings and furniture very good and the bathroom sumptuous...judging by other opinions on TA we think we were a little unlucky with the bed. There are ongoing renovations to the facade of the hotel but these are carefully managed being cleverly camouflaged and we were never disturbed or inconvenienced - but if arriving by car it has temporarily made car parking a little more difficult. As everyone at the hotel made us feel so very welcome we really hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: CHRISPDUCK
Reviews.Content: For my 40th birthday, my husband took me to Paris & booked the Crillon as a surprise. It was just perfect. From the delicate rose scent on entering the lobby, to the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, I cannot fault a thing. The staff are formal, but still approachable & efficient, with excellent dinner recommendations to suit our needs. One concierge, on seeing my very high heels, offered the hotel car to take us to a restaurant just around the corner. The junior suite we had was beautiful, absolutely spotless and a real treat to enjoy. One rainy day, we even went back just to enjoy the room-something we never do - usually we only use a hotel room as a base. We didn't eat in the hotel. I cannot comment on cost (I prefer not to know how much my husband spent!) but as a once-in-a-lifetime treat it was truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world bar none”
Reviews.Author: tedvoute
Reviews.Content: The Crillon is the best Hotel that my wife and I have stayed at. The service was fantastic. The staff always had a smile and very attentive without being intrusive. We had a three year old who was accommodated for in every way. We could not speak more highly of this Hotel the rooms ,the staff and the food 1st class and Five star Congratulations Hotel de Crillon

Reviews.Title: “The Crillon is what all hotels should be”
Reviews.Author: cphilipsc
Reviews.Content: From the luxurious entry and lobby, to the incredibly personal attention paid to us at check in, to our wonderfully appointed suite, this was the most satisfying hotel experience in our lives. We've stayed at many highly rated hotels in the US and Europe including Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons and The Plaza in New York and none can compare to the elegance and service that we received at The Crillon.

Reviews.Title: “A special treat”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveller00
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Hotel De Crillon for a birthday treat and it was wonderful, everything I always imagined it would be. We had a very nice stay, the hotel suprised me with a beautiful birthday cake and the breakfast was fabulous. The location is excellent, the hotel is beautiful and yes there were some works going on but it was not a bother at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: MaRoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this wonderful hotel (Jan 7 to Jan 10). The whole experience had started way before we arrived in Paris: we asked the concierge to arrange airport transfer, buy some tickets and make some bookings for us and everything was handled in the most professional manner. I am very particular to detail and I had to say that I was very impressed with the prompt and specific answers to all my questions and requests. Upon arrival we were greeted at the airport and two people were waiting for us outside the hotel to assist with the luggage, etc. The stuff of the hotel were polite and accommodating: our plane landed quite early and because our room wasn't ready, we were offered another room, so that we could freshen up. By the time we came back in the afternoon, our room was ready and all our luggage was already in the new room. And have I mentioned that we were upgraded to a suite? The rooms at the hotel are spacious and very grand: from the minute you walk into the hotel you feel that you are in the palace. Our transfer to the airport was also booked by the concierge, so even after we left the hotel, we still continued to experience Crillon's spectacular service. Throughout our stay at the hotel all the stuff were extremely helpful and polite and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. I would like to mention that we were first unsure about the hotel due to the renovations, but the only time we could hear some of the noise was the day we were checking out (Monday morning), so Friday through to Sunday night we didn't even notice anything going on except for the facade being partially closed covered. We would also like to mention their amazing restaurant Les Ambassadeurs: one of the best restaurants we have ever been to. Their new Chef Christopher Hache is definitely the greatest talent and the restaurant's staff are very professional and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel de Crillon and we hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Met and exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: WYMC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel de Crillon last week, during what must be the coldest week in early December in Paris... Before our trip, I must admit after reading many negative reviews from other tripadvisor travellers, I was a bit worried, given that we paid quite a bit for a room at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel early, no where near the usual check in time of 1 pm. Upon our request to be checked into a room as soon as possible, we were given a room almost immediately The room was on the first floor overlooking the winter garden and while it was clean and very French in design, it looked a bit worn and dated. It was howevr a very large room. The room was chilly, so we turned on the heating to full blast and went out for a spot of shopping. When we came back to the hotel some 4 hours later, the room was still cold. We called the front desk and a technician arrived promptly to check on the heating. We were told it was fine, although the warm air coming out of the vent was weak. We called the front desk again when it was still cold after giving the heater another half hour to warm up, and we were offered a change of room. Rhea came within 5 minutes of my phone call to escort us to another room on the second floor which was warm and toasty, and even offered us hot tea to warm up. It was a lovely stay, the hotel room was very quiet until about 10 am in the morning when renovation works would start, the bed was most comfortable, and most of all, the heater in our new room works!! I'm most happy with the service received at this hotel, all our concerns were addressed almost immediately, staff were friendly and helpful, the concierge is a fountain of information on everything Parisian and I would make Hotel de Crillon my default hotel of choice whenever I'm in Paris from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: KirkPA
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th trip to Paris and our second stay at the hotel de Crillon. Attention to detail and outstanding service from the reception staff, concierge and restaurant staff help to justify the expense. If you are looking for a quiet, private and elegant hotel to have a romantic trip with your significant other, I can think of no other that would meet those criteria. Please remember, if you are not looking for a historically significant, classic palace and are not willing ot pay for it, do not stay at the Crillon. This is the hotel that creates the service level that the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton could only hope to meet. Fot that level of service, there is definitely a cost. One great positive is that it is much smaller than The Ritz, the George V and the Plaza Athinee - and much more private than the Meurice. Thank you to Thor and his staff for making this an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy beauty”
Reviews.Author: alicewaltinska
Reviews.Content: My favorite Paris!!!! I love to go on business trips to Paris, what a pleasure! I booked hotel via amex concierge service. They upgraded me and had a limo service from airport and back for free. Hotel de Crillon is a timeless classy beauty! Service is impeccable! everything is so beautiful and elegant! My room had cozy bedroom upstairs and big lounge downstairs. It is right in the center of everything, great for shopping and right next to my favorite Buddah Bar! Breakfast is exquisite, anything you can imagine! Fresh yummy croasans ! Cant wait to go back to this hotel of perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Still dreaming about it!”
Reviews.Author: fnil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Crillon for four indulgent nights, we really splashed out and would not normally stay at a hotel this expensive but we definately felt it was worth every hard-earned penny. We stayed for the four days running up to Christmas last year, the Champs Elysees was lit up, the Christmas market was on, we went to the opera, the Moulin rouge, drank hot wine in the Tuileries - it was a dream trip and the Crillon fit in perfectly. We ate breakfast each morning at the hotel and the food was wonderful. We found the front desk service charming and helpful, the bar was quiet but pleasant for a glass of wine. Location is super. The only criticism would be our room was slightly shabby (the bathroom to be specific) but the room service and housekeeping was wonderful. I have only stayed in a few five stars but this was the most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “An American in Paris - the usual!”
Reviews.Author: Momtravel33
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel is reflective of my experience with Paris as a whole: gorgeous, sophisticated, mouth-watering, fashionable. However, no matter how long you stay, how well you use those manners or how much you paid for your scarf, will you ever feel truly welcome. We were guests in December during what is the most gorgeous time for the city as well as the hotel. Check in was uneventful and we were escorted to our room which was on the top floor with a short ceiling, a dormer window, and tiny. Since it didn't look like we were expecting it to, we called and asked to be moved. The staff for the most part was helpful and we enjoyed the next seven nights in a large, well appointed room on a slightly lower floor. Although we never had dinner there we thought the food was amazing and breakfast was a treat each morning. At the end of the day, however, it was a case of not speaking the language (using Spanish I found this to improve) and not having any other redeeming qualities beyond paying 800€ for a room that warranted friendly service. To be fair, the staff never fell short on any requests we made. It was more in the attitude. Overall, this is a stunning hotel in a great location. I would stay there again (sometimes their beauty outsizes my pride) and would recommend it to a friend provided they either speak French or are already aware and prepared for what happens when they don't.

Reviews.Title: “Service, comfort, views”
Reviews.Author: Lissy255100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Crillon as part of a family trip in Europe. The service in the hotel was impeccable, and they really took care of the children, who were in an interconnecting room. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel Pampers Guests”
Reviews.Author: CoachDave37
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at the Hotel de Crillon for the second time from 9/13-9/17/2010. We last stayed there in 2000 and were thoroughly impressed. Ten years later, many of the same hotel staff were still there, and still performing their duties with the utmost professionalism and, as the French might say, savoir faire. Our room wasn't ready at the hotel's check in time, but the clerk remedied that by sending us to the bar for complimentary champagne (whatever we wanted) and snacks. When he returned an hour later, he took us to our room which he promised we would love and we did as it had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and the other sites. The rest of our stay was great, and the concierge helped us out by figuring out how to ship some excess luggage back to the US as we stayed in France for almost a month. And Kevin the bar tender (he is the guy who receives the white rose from the actress in the Crillon's lead-in on the website) should have been a stand-up comedian. He kept the bar hopping every night. Bottom line: the location is great, the hotel is quiet and the staff very helpful and friendly. It is expensive however, but so are other comparable hotels in other great cities.

Reviews.Title: “classy old world french hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacknangela
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our first visit to Paris. We got the Presidential suite for €1850/night for 3 nights. The suite itself was small compared to what we are used to (we are from Las Vegas) but it was decorated in very authentic french decor and very elegant. The location is perfect for seeing the sights. The "Crillon" breakfast each day was great. Overall we would stay here again but only for a significantly lower rate per night.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of George V”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hotel de Crillon and to be honest the only reason we stayed there was due to the fact the Hotel Meurice and George V were both booked the nights we needed. Any review must put the hotel in context to its competitors and though the Crillon is a nice hotel is falls short in comparison to the other two hotels listed above. The service is good but not great, the rooms are nice but tired, the bathrooms fall short in comparison and the bed was a bit hard. The in room breakfast was nice, the location is good and we did get an upgrade from the friendly check in staff so not all was lost. Again I come back to the fact that for the price point you can do better in Paris, period.

Reviews.Title: “My standard for a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_andrews
Reviews.Content: My sister splurged and booked a room at this hotel for a Paris meetup. It was, and remains, the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed at.
