Yes, there is a serious snob factor at play here. It was the first hotel where I experienced a check in desk that is actually sit down at a desk. The staff is very formal but professional (for me, this does not mean looking down at you, so much as maintaining a serious distance between the customer and the staff). The hotel is beautiful and the location is at the very heart of Paris (right on on the Place de la Concorde). I have judged every hotel since by this standard, and none have yet met it. Note: this stay was prior to Oct 2009.

Reviews.Title: “I don't see what all the fuss is about...”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpicer
Reviews.Content: We kicked off our two week visit to France with what was supposed to be 4 nights of unrivalled luxury and spoiling in the Grand Dame of Paris hotels. We were somewhat disappointed. On arrival by taxi from CDG, our luggage was taken from the car (by my husband and the taxi driver) and left sitting in the street while while the uniformed staff decided what to do with it and who should carry the blessed stuff inside. One might believe this was an entirely new scenario for them, or perhaps our battered, well worn cases weren't up to their marque. We had arrived at the hotel early in the morning around 7.30 am) so didn't expect an immediate check-in. Registration was handled very pleasantly and I assume at some stage someone deigned to bring our luggage in off the street since it did make it to our room later. We were told that our upgrade (as promised by Amex concierge booking) was available (but in retrospect, I don't care to think about what a less luxurious room would have been like.) The rate we paid was only about EUR 60 less than the rack rate posted in the room. We returned to the hotel late morning but the room was still not ready so we went out for a slightly weary lunch. Returning after 3pm we were shown to Room 10, on the first floor of the hotel overlooking the courtyard. A reasonably spacious room but not a suite by any standard. There was a gentle hubbub from the courtyard which, I would imagine, could become irritating in the busier summer months if you want a really quiet room. With the curtains open and a light on (winter mornings?) you are most very visible to the other guests in rooms overlooking the courtyard. Time for a nap in a faultlessly comfortable bed with good quality and clean linens. My impression in September was that with all windows closed, the room would be very stuffy (the air conditioning was below standard, but as we live in the Middle East, it often seems that way in Europe). That evening we tried to book for the Sunday champagne brunch in the hotel restaurant but were told it was full. Do the hotel keep some tables back for guests, releasing them only on the morning of the brunch to non-residents if not booked by then (as happens in our local 5 stars), or were we just unlucky? Given the price and 'reputation' this hotel enjoys, the bathroom was disappointing. The over-bath shower had a poorly fitting screen which meant the bathroom flooded every time one showered, resulting in either a floor strewn with sodden towels or a slippery marble floor. Furthermore, as a result of this constant water damage, the wood around the surround of the bathroom door was black with mould and the tiles in the adjacent lavatory had cracked - neither pleasing to the eye nor hygenic. There was no bidet in the bathroom which, given the overall condition, could be considered a blessing. The towels could be larger - bath sheets, anyone? As usual, the lighting and set up was dreadful for putting on make-up and there was no dressing table in the bedroom, so that was a bit hit and miss (why do hotels that must spend a fortune on interior design fail in these most basic areas? I need to put my face on in either head-on natural light or in a mirror with lights at the side - overhead lights give funny shadows. Is it really so difficult to organise this, chaps?) Overall, as others have said, this is eye-wateringly expensive but lacks the attention to detail one might expect for the price. Nice breakfast, flaky service, terrible coffee (as usual in hotels). Great bed. Great (complimentary) afternoon tea with lots of tea, savouries and good quality pastry/cakey pig stuff. Bar is low key, expensive as expected, restaurant we can't comment on as they didn't have space for us. It's low key classy, which keeps the flashy (insert nationality of your choice here) types away mostly, but do they want to deter regular paying customers expecting something a bit special too?

Reviews.Title: “aside from the check in, overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: savvychic08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Crillon for 2 nights on the 5th floor. The check in process took some time. My friend indicated on the reservation for 2 single beds, but the check-in officer was not aware about this so she had to make some arrangements. When we were brought to our room, we had to wait for housekeeping to re-make the beds. Also, the room itself was located in front of the elevator - I raised my concerns that it may be too loud and noisy. We were assured that it would be very quiet. To my disappointment, I woke up the next morning by conversations on the hallway. If I had understood french, I would be able to translate every word I heard. Even with a double door, the conversation was clearly audible. Aside from the check in process and loud noise in the morning, the hotel's concierge service was great. They were very knowledgable and were able to provide great directions to different places as well as recommend good restaurants close by. We also had drinks at the bar and the service was just as professional and great as expected. The check out process was very speedy and on par. Overall atmostphere of the hotel is very charming and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and distinction”
Reviews.Author: Default30001
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Paris. Luxury, service, distinction, gastronomy. They have all. Very well served, even our local Barcelona's newspaper every morning at our room. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Posh, elegant and at your service”
Reviews.Author: EvatheDiva
Reviews.Content: Hotel Crillon well deserves its reputation of being one of the best hotels in the world. From the minute you step inside the lobby you are treated like royalty. The rooms are huge and beautiful, with enormous marble bathrooms and mahogany lined walk-in closets. The beds are extra comfortable, with feather beds and crisp linens. The breakfast is served in a beautiful room with ceiling murals, and the food served is simply superb, as is the service. Nothing beats the location of this exquisite hotel, and nothing can top the view of the Place de la Concorde and the Seine seen from the huge windows.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: richardson30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days recently and was very impressed with service for checking in to departure. Booked through LHW.com in advance and was offered a fabulous rate including b/fast deluxe room - when we arrived we were upgraded to Junior suite. 231 for anyone interested, large room, high ceilings. Very happy. My husband thought the breakfast was the best he has eaten anywhere. Gym was good. Would recommed. Concierges were excellent and managed to reserve all our first choice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling quite a lot all over the world, including all five continents. I would not hesitate to say that De Crillon is FOR SURE in my top 5 list of favourite hotels. Either way, I always enjoy being in Paris, but staying at De Crillon was an extra bonus. Located in the heart of the city at place de la Concorde, it's the ideal base to stroll at Champs Elysees or take the metro to go to Louvre, tour Eiffel etc.. Great breakfast with smoked salmon and caper, all the usual croissants etc.. Spacious rooms with wifi, LCD screens and everything else you would expect from a 5-star hotel. To cut the long way short, if you are willing to pay that extra euro for accommodation in Paris, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnifique. !!”
Reviews.Author: JGooglie
Reviews.Content: That's the extent of my French... We booked this hotel for our Paris celebration of our 35th Anniversary.. It was truly magnificent.. My wife and my daughters had stayed there a decade prior and loved it, so she recommended it.. The service was exceptional form the check-in to the dining to the bar to the checkout. The Concierge was always totally helpful and accommodating and so was Anthony in the dining areas. He was top class! The rooms were beautiful - rooms because we had a French Riviera break before we headed back to Paris. We were in Paris for Bastille day celebrations I was able to get great shots of the parade from just outside of the front door - open view of the proceedings in Place Concorde.. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for class and service par-excellence.. The Farias - Unionville Canada

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional throughout”
Reviews.Author: FredsGM
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the way south. Had wife and young toddler in tow. The other reviews just do not dfo this hotel justice and waffle with no objectivity. You cannot please all the people all the time or the staff cannot mind read. But, i can see they are as close to mind readers as is possible. They do welcome and look after children they do provide excellent childrens food and they were so welcoming and friendly throughout!!! Our boy still has his crillon elepohant, he loved the crayons and detail and all staff were friendly welcoming and G-E-N-U-I-N-E. Overall service, rooms, friendliness, courtesy, pricing for a five star deluxe hotel- best in Paris. AND they have some parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Excusive !!! LOVE IT !”
Reviews.Author: TravelLeila
Reviews.Content: I’m not a big writer, but this Hotel was the BEST from 3 I have been staying in Paris ! Love the fresh rouses everyday + eating breakfast with silver cutlery! Very luxury, push & something to remember We got backyard view which was nice & quiet. Its expensive, but we got a good rate booking online!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position but child friendly? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: MaureenHerts
Reviews.Content: My eight year old daughter and I have just returned from 3 days at this famous hotel. We chose this hotel, even though it was extremely expensive, because of its position and because they claim to be child friendly. When we arrived, the lady who took us to our room was very friendly and my daughter was given a cuddly toy and some colouring books which was a great start. However, when I tried to get her something to eat there, things became more difficult. I had asked the lady who showed us to our room which restaurant would be best to try with a child and she said that L'Obe was the best as it was less formal and that their (other) flagship restaurant would be too rich for a child. I therefore took my daughter to L'Obe and was surprised that they had no children's menu. The only menu that was available was too sophisticated for an English 8 year old. When I asked if the chef would be able to provide a pizza or some plain pasta with tomato sauce while I had the published menu, the response was "absolutely not". I was amazed at this reaction. When I asked the concierge which restaurant I should try, he advised me to have room service or go outside the hotel. This is not acceptable as you don't go to Paris to eat in your hotel room! The good parts of the hotel were undoubtedly the position which meant we could walk everywhere and the lovely bathroom and comfortable beds which we both enjoyed. The concierge was very pleasant and helpful. On the down side, I was supposed to have a complimentary bottle of champagne in my room on arrival and had to ring up about it twice before I got it. I don't think I would go there again with a child. I notice that their website says they have a children's menu, but this is only room service.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: denhunt58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a while ago, and have always intended to write my review, but life sort of took over, and I feel that I'm always quicker at reviewing bad experiences than the good ones, so now need to rectify this! This hotel is excellent in every regard - from check-in to departure, the whole experience is a five star plus. It puts other so called 5 star hotels to shame. We've booked several hotels from the Five Star Alliance web site, and the De Crillon leaves the others lacking in every respect. The staff are excellent and know all there is to a professional, friendly efficiency. They treat all guests the same, whether said guests are dripping Louis Vuitton luggage or luggage of a lesser brand! The rooms are sumptuous and very pleasant, and when we stayed (I explained via email that the trip was for our 25th wedding anniversary celebration) the hotel went the extra mile, and place a lovely bottle of Tattinger bubbly in the room, a lovely fruit bowl, and chocs. They even upgraded us to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. These small touches make all the difference, and yes, it is expensive, but when weighed against the other costs of other lesser quality hotels (both in Paris, and around the world) the experience of the De Crillon is well worth it. The food in the Obelisk restaurant (now the 'L'Obe I think) is excellent, although we didn't try Ambassadeurs (apologies for incorrect spelling), as we thought this may break the bank a little!! Breakfast was part of our deal, and it was the best I've ever had, I loved it, and we can't wait to revisit very soon. I've a half century to celebrate soon, so I think this is top of my list of what I want to do to celebrate. I agree with everyone else here who has said that everyone should stay at the De Crillon at least once in their lifetime. It's a must! (I also love that the General Manager takes the time to reply to these reviews, not seen on Trip Advisor often!).

Reviews.Title: “It's been a long time and we look forward to being at the Crillon again.”
Reviews.Author: joninnj1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I will be in Paris again this July. This will be our 3rd stay at the Crillon. We were last there 10 years ago and will celebrate number 35 there this July. This will be our 3rd stay at the Crillon and though we considered other hotels, we just couldn't resist the best location and service imaginable. I anticipate that all will be as enjoyable and top rate as before.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, insanely expensive”
Reviews.Author: jgm2
Reviews.Content: I suppose we've been spoiled spending the past few stays in Paris at George V but Le Cinq is beginning to take liberties with their insane rates and for two adjoining rooms the Crillon was about half the price so we thought we'd give it a go. It's still gum-bleedingly expensive though. Check-in was efficient and helpful. The rooms were adequate but nothing like the size of rooms at George V nor were the showers/bathrooms anything like the same scale. Rate included a buffet breakfast which was excellent although they did try and stick us for the breakfast on the bill at checkout so stay alert out there people. Business centre wanted to charge us for use of the computers. S'cuse me? 1,000 quid a night (two adjoining rooms) and you want me to pay to print off my boarding passes? You what? Fortunately the concierge saw sense and printed 'em off gratis. No spa but the fitness room proved a big hit with the kids who had the place to themselves while they tried out the static bikes and treadmills and suchlike with their irreverent lunacy. Probably would have annoyed more serious fitness fanatics if there had been anybody else there. Bar INSANELY expensive for a drink. 22 Euros for a G&T. I could buy a bottle and a straw for that kind of cash. Complimentary nibbles very pedestrian - peanuts and crisps. At that kind of price for a drink you expect foie gras and caviar canapes. Well I do. Had lunch off lobby area. Good, but, again, insanely expensive. On the upside the hotel is very well positioned. Right on Place de la Concorde with Metro station entrance no more than 20 yards from the front door. Views of famous sights all around the second you set foot outside. Walking distance to most of the main tourist sites. Would I stay there again? Hmmm. Hard to be sure. It's a great location, the staff are helpful, the rooms are okay but not huge, the common areas sumptuous but then you'd expect that to be the case for that kind of money. Perhaps I just need to get used to the idea that 1,000 quid doesn't buy what it used to but if I was feeling flusher I'd still stay at George V. It's not that Le Crillon is bad it's just that George V is, somehow, in a hundred tiny little ways, just so much better. I'm obviously spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Grande dame de Paris, still working well and incredible location”
Reviews.Author: Dopanijoso
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Crillon for two days while i attended a conference in Paris. The location is spectacular, on the Place de la Concorde, walking distance from the Louvre, across the street from the Jeu de Paume, Palais Royale, Petit Palais, at the foot of the Chamls Eleysees etc. If you love great Parisian architecture, I can't imagine a better location. Check-in was efficient and after completing the formalities I was escorted up to my Deluxe King room on the first floor (two levels up in the elevator from the ground floor). The room was decorated in classic grand old French style, with heavy drapes and was medium sized with a coffee table and two chairs and a desk as well as a large flat screen tv. I was slightly surprised to see that the bathroom was exceptionally new, very nice and spacious with both tub and seperate shower, lavatory and bidet, all in nice marble with mirrors and a double sink and excellent toiletries provided. Wireless internet was included with the room, but breakfast was an additional $40 for continental. The room service menu offered a good range of choices at silly prices ($48 for a Grey Goose and tonic!!! $38 for a pizza, although this looks like bargain relative to the $50 plain pizza at the Ritz Paris room service menu.) Service throughout my stay was excellent, the concierge was helpful in choosing and booking me an alternative restaurant when my first choice was unavailable. I used the gym on the fifth floor, which was spotlessly clean, completely empty (Paris doesn't have much of an exercise culture) and with a good selection of machines. Check out was the only service snafu, it took close to ten minutes as there was only one person on the desk and five rooms wanting to check out. All in all I would highly recommend the hotel and view it as a superior choice in all respects than the other great grande dame - The Ritz, whose rooms, service and attitude to guests is in all respects inferior to that of the Crillon. The Ritz also charges even higher prices and has the balls to charge $30 per day for internet on top of $1000 per night for the room. The Hotel de Crillon is expensive, but everyone should splurge and stay there at least once.

Reviews.Title: “So gracious. It transformed my idea of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Santa_Fe_Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I ha not been to Paris for more than 20 years because I had found the people there to be rude and unfriendly to anyone who did not speak French. The staff at the Hotel de Crillon, from the moment of my arrival, stet out to change my ideas about Paris. WOW ! This place is elegant, gracious, historic and within walking distance of The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, Couture shopping and the finest dining in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings - Amazing and disappointing all within one day”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_in_Tokyo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel (28th May), this was the last night of our two week holiday in Germany and Paris. For four nights in Paris we stayed at Hotel Saint Paul, and we had planned to treat ourselves to a very special hotel for one night. It was the "dream" hotel for my wife. Lets start off with the good, the location, wow, wow, for a tourist in Paris the view just outside the door of this hotel does not get any better. We had a standard room but was very large (especially for Paris) and the bathroom was also very impressive. Great furnishings as well, very classic. We ordered room service, and that was very good,(pricey yes), but the service was like a 5 star restaraunt being brought into our hotel room. No kid awkwardly delivering something but instead two very professional men. Breakfast was also really good, great quality and fantastic setting and atmosphere. Now for the disappointing; we arrived early and couldn't properly check in, but we left our luggage and came back just after 3 to check in. Taken to our hotel room, very impressed but our luggage wasn't there and neither was the complimentary bottle of champagne as part of our package. Called reception a couple of times and our luggage finally got there, at least an hour later, same with the champagne. Both should have been in our room when we arrived or at least within a few minutes of our arrival. Not a major issue but with this class and cost of hotel, service needs to be flawless. Additional disappointment on our checkout, as we were leaving the hotel to get into the taxi, porter put the case in the taxi and broke the handle. Accidents happen but did not appreciate a lack of apology from the porter and even a laugh. Have stayed at hotels in all classes, and like in all service industries its often the little things that can make a difference. For us they didn't meet this This should have been a five out o five review. Hope they can learn from the critical feedback we provided.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel, staff, and service”
Reviews.Author: bigheaddedp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we had a wonderful experience. Approximately a week before our stay, the hotel staff sent us an e-mail asking us about our preferences so that they can best accommodate our needs. Everything that I wrote in the form was met (and more). Then, came the volcano...We had to reschedule our reservation with the hotel a couple of times (at least 3 times) and they were very understanding (unlike a number of other hotels and Easyjet...). Finally, we arrived at the hotel (almost a week and a half behind the scheduled date) and we were greeted by a warm and welcoming receptionist. The check-in process was very quick. She must have realized that we were exhausted, so I think she made the process quicker than normal (how attentive!). She then led us to our room and showed us around to make sure that it was acceptable. And acceptable it was! It was one of the most beautiful rooms that we have ever stayed in (if not the most), and we were very pleasantly surprised to see how large and elegant the room was (I was blown away by the marbled floor bathroom!). On the coffee table, there was another pleasant surprise waiting for us: a hot pot of water (with an assortment of tea). How did they know when we were going to check in? We left the hotel for a few hours, and upon our return from dinner, we were again surprised by the thoughtfulness of the hotel staff. There was a bottle of champagne and fruit on the table, with rose petals decorating the bed and the bath tub. Upon entering the room, we both looked at each other and were confused. We thought that we entered someone else's room. What a night it was. Furthermore, the hotel staff are very well trained. When we requested items, the staff that answered the phone replied "immediately sir" and they brought them up immediately. When I asked the receptionist about where I can buy a nice set of tea cups, the concierge called within 2 minutes listing places that we can try. I realize now that I didn't give much information about the room or the hotel location, but I was just simply amazed by the hotel staff and their service. The hotel is located in the heart of Paris (at the Place de la Concorde), next to a street (St. Honore) that houses all of the name brand stores that you can think of. The room we stayed in was beautifully decorated, with modern amenities, and an open terrace. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a once in a lifetime experience. I'm glad we chose the hotel to celebrate our anniversary, and we would never forget about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: brausimausi
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful long weekend at the hotel De Crillon. From the moment we stepped into the hotel everybody was helpfull, friendly and competent. There was nothing to complain about, not a single fault. With Amex Platinum ,we were upgraded to a beautiful huge room with a little terrace. Breakfast was lavish ,served in the famous restaurant. when paying the bill, there was not a single unauthorised charge, not even for breakfast in the room. when our flight was canceled the concierge had TGV tikets for us within a few minutes . A chauffeur was waiting for us and whisked us away to the train station. I would recommend the De Crillon anytime, service , ambience and location are perfect. But it is the service that make this hotel outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: abdel4u
Reviews.Content: The best Hotel in paris. Best place, friendly and efficient staff. A hotel with a history that no other hotel have in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location, but for better or for worse, a 5-star hotel that caters to those w/ 5-star wallets”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: The Crillon is beautiful, with a perfect location and charming rooms. Our room was small, but had a walk-in closet/dressing area and a bathroom with full bath and separate shower. Despite the size, it was comfortable and very pleasant. Housekeeping is immaculate and skillfully unobtrusive, providing cleaning and turndown automatically when guests are away and- in a nice touch- calling to politely ask guests still in their rooms if and when they'd like to be served. That said, this luxury hotel clearly caters to a certain clientele. My polite request for a room with any kind of view was ignored; my room, while lovely, was small and looked out over an interior courtyard. It was hard not to feel that my request had been intentionally ignored. Staff descends upon you during check-in and check-out; those who prefer to carry their own bags the additional few feet from reception to the room or the street rather than shell out euros to bellhops for unwanted service may feel self-conscious. There is an unquestionable snootiness to the place that may also make those not accustomed to this type of hotel somewhat uncomfortable, and guests should expect anything to be a la carte and pricey. This is not the type of hotel that offers free coffee in the room; it can be ordered from room service for 4x what you'd pay anywhere else. Don't even think about touching the phones; even a toll-free call results in a 1-2 euro charge. Finally, although free (and wonderfully fast) wifi in the rooms is a very nice touch, the business center inexplicably charges by the minute for use of a computer; there is a staff member there 24 hours a day seemingly for the sole purpose of selling access to the computers. Suggestion to hotel: lose the staffer and use the saved salary to replace what is essentially an ultra-expensive internet cafe with a true business center with free computer access for guests. Again, however, the hotel is beautiful, the housekeeping service is wonderful, and the location is perfect. In short, I'd recommend this hotel without reservation to those accustomed to a certain level of luxury and service. That said, I have stayed in a number of 5-star hotels that make every guest feel like a 5-star guest regardless of what they paid for the room or what services they use; this is not one of them. Those looking to splurge for a special occasion and want a hotel that will make them feel special, however, may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful piece of history.”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our Valentine's weekend at this lovely hotel. I loved it! Our room wasn't the nicest room we've every stayed in, however, we had a wonderful time and all in all I love this hotel. The breakfast was very good and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pompyb
Reviews.Content: Even though Crillon is very pricey the location cannot be beat. It's near Champs de Lysees. The rooms are small but if you want to stay in palatial style in the city of lights with so much history you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollyL2
Reviews.Content: From the room with 2 balconies with a view of the Eiffel Tower, to the scrumptious breakfasts, to the excellent location, this hotel was the perfect place to stay on an anniversary trip to Paris. When we arrived, we were given an interior room. When we asked for a better room, they accomodated us almost immediately. The staff is excellent. The decor is old world but we had modern amenities. Heated floors and towel rack in the bathroom were nice too.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing New Year experience in a fantastic hotel with excellent service and no detail untouched.”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseFalls
Reviews.Content: On arrival into the hotel we were delighted with what met us, attentive staff and a breathtakingly beautiful reception area. From the minute we were shown our suite we were always treated with that little bit extra nothing was too much trouble whether it was concierge or housekeeping. Quickly sorting out a last minute New Years Dinner at an hours notice and bringing up forgotten toiletries. We are use to staying in five star hotels around the world with mixed reviews but would certainly class this hotel at the top end. Classy hotel with excellent service in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with professional staff”
Reviews.Author: norvagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during christmas. This was my 5th or 6th stay here, and this hotel or rather there staff is getting better for each time.. When we checked in we where told we are now concidered regulars and upgraded us from a junior suite to a superior suite.. Nice.... Beautiful suite over two floors with great view over the eiffel tower.. Handwritten letter from a staff welcoming us, and a bottle of Chablis and some snack( pata negra, caviar, smoked salmon and foie gras all on toast) was brought to the room as a welcome... The extremly proffesional, personal and serviceminded guys at the bar at the hotel, made our stay even better, remembering our favorite cocktails( 8 months since last stay).. Small things that i like my white lady a little sweeter, it just happened.. Impressive I could go on and on, but if you dont experience Crillon in a positive way, then there is something wrong with you ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgeslin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crillon one night during a business trip. The location is really great on the place de la Concorde. Crillon is very nicely decorated and the service offered is excellent. My room was nice, a little bit too small but the bathroom was really superb. The room service was great. The two restaurant delivered excellent cuisine and are very efficient. I strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unrivalled Decadence for our Spyns Tour de France Trips”
Reviews.Author: Spyns
Reviews.Content: I have been taking Tour de France groups to the Crillon for the past 2 years and can understand why this is Lance's favourite hotel. Walking in to the Crillon is a little daunting at first because you've never seen so much gilt and marble in one large room before (hotel reception actually). The Crillon is a relatively small hotel, fewer than 100 rooms, and it was the perfect venue for Spyns Tour de France trip last year. With an unbeatable location on the Place de la Concorde, an excellent breakfast, and the world-famous courtyard complete with perfumed mist, the Crillon provides a level of service worth of its 5 stars...but the whole thing comes at 5-star prices as well.

Reviews.Title: “pretty darn close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: citymouse225
Reviews.Content: not exactly what one would call a value, but boy if you're going to spend this is the place. Great size, great location, great service, no attitude.

Reviews.Title: “fairytale trip”
Reviews.Author: crackersCa
Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel, spacious and elegant rooms, staff were amazing

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Again!”
Reviews.Author: holidaywithweeones
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had stayed here with our children (4 &2). We contacted the hotel by phone & e-mail in advance to confirm re cot & put up bed etc. On our arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite - fab! Complimentary fruit platter, water etc and snacks for kids. They provided a beautiful gift bag for the kids full of toys, games and chocolate. Provided nappy bag with baby toiletries and bib etc. Turn down service included laying out mini crillon slippers for kids! So cute! They even have a special kids treasure hunt where our daughter got to choose a delicious pastry as her prize - really well done for kids. No problems getting milk for kids at any time of day. Wonderful location, very helpful concierge. Great room service. Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “You, too, can ruin your special celebration at de Crillon!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQNewEngland
Reviews.Content: To celebrate a major milestone in birthdays, we booked a six night stay at the "executive rate" at Hotel de Crillon through 1800hotels.com. The hotel knew, before we arrived, of our celebration and the concierge was efficient and prompt in obtaining dinner reservations at *** star restaurants. I was naive, however, in thinking that Crillon might appreciate this six-night PREPAID booking from a new customer. We arrived on Monday at 12:30 in the afternoon and were asked to wait an hour while they prepared the room, which was understandable. What was unforgivable however, was the room that they then gave us. An agglomeration of 4 small rooms, with the toilet in a closet at one end, [hand sink didn't drain], a 7' x 10' sitting room overcrowded with two tables, two chairs, a small sofa and an old, ugly floor lamp, a bedroom barely larger than the king size bed with less than 2' circulation space between the foot of the bed and the wall, an adequate dressing room, and then a bathroom [located 25 feet from the toilet] with a bathtub [didn't drain] with the shower in it, but no shower stall, no heated floor, no bidet - rather a given - in a French hotel. It took us 24 hours of wrangling with Xavier [mentioned in other reviews] to extricate ourselves from this horrow show. I had thought my extended stay might earn me an upgrade - certainly not a DOWNGRADE - instead I experienced an hotelier who clearly did not value a six night booking. Perhaps we should have arrived in torn jeans and a tee-shirt and we would have been more to their liking. Starting our very expensive reservation with this cavalier treatment was infuriating, and while they tried to mollify us with a strawberry fuilliette and a bottle of champagne, Crillon has left me with a very bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “It is a beautiful hotel, at an excellent location in a very charming city”
Reviews.Author: love-2-travel_2820
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel, at an excellent location in a very charming city. I can’t remember the name of our room (did not have a number) but it was very spacious and charming. Huge walk in closet, sauna, steam room and big bath tub. Staff was friendly (especially taking into consideration that we are in Paris) There were complementary mineral water and cookies in the room, and a teddy bear for our daughter. The extra bed for our daughter was very old and worn out, had been sown and fixed a few times, instead of replacing it. We left my husbands shoos outside the door for polishing – Well that didn’t happen! There were about 4 lights bulbs in the room that didn’t work! The shower was very blocked, so water only came out a few holes! We expected things to be close to perfect in a hotel like this! I did inform the management after our stay, and they apologized – next time we come back we would get an upgrade. But we haven’t been back. Breakfast was excellent, the best I have ever experienced. We also enjoyed lunch in Les Ambasadeurs – Very very nice. But all in all it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “What we needed”
Reviews.Author: whenucan-travel
Reviews.Content: Our family was at the Crillon closing off a trip through Languedoc and Bordeaux. We were travelling with young children. The staff at the Crillon made every effort to make our stay and activities in Paris enjoyable and absolutely seamless. The staff at the Front Desk, the Concierge and Doormen provided prompt professional service with an attention to detail and a willing attitude but without any unnecessary fuss. The hotel is beautiful, quiet and intimate. It seemed rare to cross the path of more than a few guests as one moved through the hotel. Compliments and thanks to the personnel of the Crillon

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Crillon is a good hotel with polite service, excellent location and nice rooms. However, the hotel lacks the same intimacy and atmosphere that Le Bristol (which is my favourite hotel in Paris) has. So next time I will return to Le Bristol.

Reviews.Title: “Small enough to be intimate - amazing”
Reviews.Author: sulumanly
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 nights at de Crillon. From the moment we arrived we loved every minute. The staff were wonderful. Nothing was too much trouble. Everything was done immediately. It feels like being in a palace. It does not have that huge business hotel feel. The staff were calling me by name which was nice. You feel as though you are 'home'. The concierge got 2 tickets to the ballet at the Paris Opera - the day before. The tickets were the best in the house! Fantastic! It is really expensive to eat anything here and the snacks are not that amazing. The chips served with the finger sandwiches and at the bar are old tasting. The breakfast is nice but not fantastic. The breads and croissants are way better in small patisseres outside of the hotel. ( although there are none around this area ) The hot food was not appealing at all. The staff however were wonderful. Just to sit in the breakfast room is an event in itself. Really beautiful So to sum it up - do not go for the food. I did not eat in the top restaurant. That is probably amazing but be prepared to pay! In the evening there is no atmosphere in the bar. Pretty dull with a few business men. I have since been told that The Buddha bar, just next door is amazing. So everyone probably goes there! I will be back and look forward to it. In fact I cannot wait! If you are deciding between the Hyatt and de Crillon. de Crillon wins by a french mile!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location but service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: joannesim77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crillon when me and my hubby visited Paris for a day. The hotel's decor is charming and quaint. The location was also great, close to major shopping districts. We enjoyed going to Laduree for breakfast which was just the next block where the hotel was located. The 2-Michelin starred restaurant is a must-go when visiting the Crillon, but be warned, its rather pricey. What needs to be improved is the service. When we walked into the hotel, the service staff at the door looked suspiciously at the both of us and then asked rather rudely what we were doing there. I would have expected better service standards from them especially when first impressions count.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: pjschaad
Reviews.Content: We could not wait to get to Paris and stay at the Hotel De Crillon. All of the staff were extremely helpful and fluent and english. The hotel is beautiful, extremely well maintained for an older building, and in the best location for the museums, shopping, and sightseeing. We highly recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfection”
Reviews.Author: Sylvester1975
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and enjoyed every second of our stay in Paris. From the moment we arrived in Paris, the Crillon staff made our stay as comfortable as possible. We were greeted at the airport by two friendly smiling Crillon staff members as soon as we stepped off the plane who led us to our beautiful limousine. Upon arriving at the hotel we were made to feel like we had arrived home. Our room was beautiful, absolutely exquisite in every respect (and wi-fi too!) The staff were exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast and room service were amazing. I can go on and on about this hotel. My wife and I miss the Crillon immensely and can't wait to go back. Crillon we love you!! In a word - sublime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, outstanding service, lovely rooms, exquisite food”
Reviews.Author: Rachel65
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two daughters (4&7) stayed for four nights in a beautiful two bed suite, with my parents-in-law in a junior suite next door. The service levels at the hotel were exemplary from the reservations staff and concierge prior to our arrival, through the restaurant and bar staff, to the housekeeping staff. From the outside the hotel is impressive with a first rate location. The interiors are perfect. Les Ambassadeurs restaurant (where we breakfasted daily on the most delicious food my children claimed they had ever eaten) is grand but not oppressively so. The bar is small and cosy, though lacking in atmosphere when not full. The Obe restaurant serves excellent food also. Our rooms were wonderful. The hotel arranged for various gifts and amusements for my children. Unlike many other hotels, our instruction to the hotel to never attempt to use the door to our girls room was followed meticulously. A little thing, but as a parent something I find very reassuring. My parents in law are celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary later this year, which I had mentioned briefly to the reservation team. On the first night the hotel filled their room with flowers, and spread rose petals on their bed in the shape of a heart. They were enchanted. Our rooms were on the courtyard, which was very quiet. In summer I imagine they could get noisy from the use of the space below as a seating area, but on chilly spring evenings they were fine. The hotel's greatest achievement is the frindliness and service level of the staff. At no point did I feel that the staff were trying to sell us anything, they genuinely had our best interests at heart. For example, on leaving I asked for them to arrange a car for six to the station. They offered to call a 6-berth taxi or to arrange a private chauffeur. They told me the price of both, and stated the taxi would be absolutely fine for such a short journey. Given the €150 price difference, this was a not inconsiderable saving. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - business or pleasure. The price was very reasonable for such luxury, style and service. And significantly less than the rather dreary and ubiquitous upmarket chains like the FS (which I find a bit like butlins for the rich in money and poor in imagination mob).

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious retreat in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sensayuma
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay and the Champs Elysees right on the Place de la Concorde. Luxurious old style hotel but with perfect service and delicious food. Barman knows how to make a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Dream time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: asw
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay at the Crillon. Its not cheap but worth every penny for the way they make you feel so special. The staff are faultless, the hotel quite beautiful and although this is a grand hotel, there is absolutely no stuffiness whatsoever. Location perfect. When they realised it was a special birthday occasion, they upgraded us all (3 rooms), and in the afternoon of our arrival wheeled in a complimentary bottle of champagne accompanied by a melt in the mouth chocolate moussey cake. Light and delicious. The rooms looked out over the courtyard - recommend this as its quiet and peaceful. Beds very comfortable. Loads of room - although I realise that in one of the Junior suites you would expect this. All the rooms seem to be spacious which again you would expect from a hotel of this quality. We were only there for one night so no time to try out the amenities so cannot comment on those. If you want to splurge in Paris, go for the Crillon. Just once. One of those places you should visit before you die!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel & Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Camarche
Reviews.Content: After much research and consideration I decided that the Crillon was the Hotel to choose for my Wife's 40th birthday celebration. I booked directly with Concorde Hotels and found the process very user-friendly.From CDG we got a chauffer service e130(great value very new & luxurious mercedes-HUGE) From the moment we arrived I really could not believe how friendly and helpful ALL the staff were (we expected it to be abit aloof but no fear) Wonderful courtesy and professionalism every step of the way. We got an upgrade to what must have been a jnr suite (stunning) and a birthday cake for my wife (Fauchon eat your heart out) The room was really the last word in Luxury and kitted out with the best in fixtures & fittings and was far larger than we imagined (I will pay for an upgrade next time ) The bathroom top to bottom marble & the best toiletries & towels etc. We stayed for three night's with breakfast included in the rate. Breakfast is served in the Ambassadeurs restaurant and really is an event with friendly and helpful service. Here's the thing - this is a beautiful hotel with one of the best locations in Paris and it's obviously very well managed . This was a special occasion for us and we spent more than we normally would (e550 per night) But we left finding it hard to imagine staying anywhere else next time we go back to Paris. Congratulations to all of you at the Crillon you have a Hotel to be very proud of and you really know how to look after your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: DS512
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The breath-taking exterior of the magnificant Hotel de Crillon - (with it's facade decorated with a cascade of hundreds of lights for the holiday season) houses an equally awe inspiring interior. The beautifully kept marble entrance and lobby lined with glowing Christmas trees for the December month. If this was not enough to fill us with the spirit of the season, than the warmth of our greeting by the staff certainly thawed the December chill. Not only were we greeted like royalty, we were shown personally to a truly incredibly (and quiet) suite - bedecked with floral displays and personal touches by the hotel hospitality. This attention and willingness to be of assistance was apparent across the hotel and the staff within the differing divisions. The concierge had pre brought tickets for the Louvre (at the same cost of normal entrance) to save on queuing - and gave us maps and direction/ walking advice - and the house keeping dept would call us personally to see if we would like the turn down service. For a luxury and high-end accommodation, we only ever found the service helpful and friendly - right from the time of making the booking (with a special mention to the very kind Yulia in reservations) and never remotely elitist nor disregarding. If you stay at this hotel, do read about the Hotel's history - and that of the Place de la Concorde; both have rich, important and fascinating backgrounds - and there can be no more central a location than this to stay : The Louvre, Musee D'Orsay; Arc d'Triomphe; shopping district and Seine, are all but on the doorstep. After staying at this hotel on a first visit to Paris, I feel we were so spoilt we could never stay anywhere else in the city now!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NYfaninmaine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple spent three nights in Paris at the Hotel de Crillon in early September. We were on holiday so were very casual and weary from the long flights. We arrived much earlier than normal check-in, about 9am, hoping they would watch our luggage until that afternoon. We were very pleased that they accommodated us right away and showed us to our room. We had a complimentary bottle of champaigne and a fruit bowl. The rooms were magnificent and comfortable at the same time. The staff was very friendly. The concierge set us up for dinner and a show at the Moulin Rouge and provided a small but welcome credit on the price. Every aspect of our visit was exceptional from the rooms to the service. I can understand how some people may feel uncomfortable in such an upscale hotel if they are on vacation and wanting to be casual, but we were in shorts and jeans for our 4 days and never felt unappreciated by the staff, in fact we kidded with the doormen and others when they saw us in shorts during 65 degree days! In addition to making reservations for us, the concierge was helpful in planning day trips around the area, marking routes on maps for us each day. He even noted some good wine stores nearby, as we enjoyed having wine in the room each night before venturing off to dinner. Saved some money that way. Rooms service brought up wine glasses and ice at no additional charge (just a tip) each evening. We plan to go back to Paris in a few years and will likely stay at another hotel, just for variety and to visit a new section of the city. I highly recommend The Crillon to anyone who wants to be a 5 minute walk from the Louvre and perfectly located to walk to many sites while being pampered while living in a palace!

Reviews.Title: “Attitude”
Reviews.Author: anubis1
Reviews.Content: No way this place is worth the money unless you like to drop names. Location is great, but there are many other hotels in the hood. Beautiful hotel. Ambassedeurs, worthy ofd its 2 stars, rooms OK. Attitude terrible. Trust me, you do not need this place at this price.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive but lovely treat”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: It has always been my ambition to stay here so with our 12th Anniversary looming, we decided to book a night's stay. Yes! It was pricey for mere mortals like us - but worth every penny. We were very well looked after from complimentary treats to a handwritten note congratulating us. All these small touches meant a lot to us. Our suite was huge and the last word in comfort. The location is perfect - a few steps from Place de la Concorde. We ate lunch in the Obelisque restaurant before departing and can highly recommend this. The food was delectable. We only wish we could afford to go more often!

Reviews.Title: “Attitude Attitude Attitude”
Reviews.Author: twosquares
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de Crillon in June. The hotel is beautiful and the location is great. However, the service was spotty and often delivered with a serious attitude. I could not get comfortable in the environment in the hotel. I felt like the staff was doing me a favor just by speaking to me.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Encounter”
Reviews.Author: Joueur
Reviews.Content: This review is not about a stay at this hotel but about my experience in trying to access the hotel bar. I had prearranged a meeting with my wife there in the bar to have a drink after a day of sight-seeing. Prior to going to this hotel I had been to the Hotel Ritz, Place Vendome with a wonderful experience. My wife had called the hotel and later talked to the bartender while she was waiting for me. The bartender said that I should be able to come in the hotel wearing a button-down, short-sleeved shirt and shorts without any problem. Men in rugby shirts were allowed into the hotel bar, the bartender said. As I entered the hotel an employee approached me. In french I said I was going to the bar. He said I would not be comfortable there and directed me to an obscur bar in an alley alongside of the hotel despite the many restaurants in the area. I asked him what the dress code was, thinking I could put on a tie and jacket. He again said I would not be comfortable. I again asked what the dress code was and he repeated the same phrase. My wife in a dress and my 14 y/o son wearing a polo shirt and shorts later entered (walking past this employee) and went to the bar without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Crillon Experince”
Reviews.Author: hermitman
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed. The staff were great and accomodating all our requests. The hotel Concierge staff were wonderful and helped us make dinner reservations for three nights including X-mas eve dinner reservation, which is hard to make. There is absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel. My family enjoyed it very much. When I checked in, we were pleasantly surprised with the way they handled it. There were no counters for you to stand for check in. The check in was handled at a table with plenty of chairs for my family to sit while they checked us in. The person who checked us in took us to our rooms. We felt like a guest at a house rather than a hotel. IF you have kids, you have to get 2 rooms at this hotel. I had two young kids and had to get connecting rooms. The hotels does not allow 2 kids with the parents in the regular room. As I booked the room with the American Express Platinum card, we got breakfast included in the room rate as well as a 4:00 PM late check out. All the front area staff try to make it a point to know who the guests are, but once in a while the door man may stop you and ask if you are a guest before allowing you in. They were nice and polite, but it was a bit uncomfortbale for my spouse. I guess it is good to know that the safety is taken seriously and I did not mind the extra question. Overall, I will say this is an excellent hotel. It is definetly more expensive, but the extra dollars you spend here will be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TravelingM0m2007
Reviews.Content: After renting an apartment in Paris for a week, we moved to the Hotel de Crillon when our flight home was canceled due to an Air France strike, and we had to extend our stay for a couple of days. We thought staying in a top-flight hotel would cheer us up, and we hoped that the concierge would help us work out our flight arrangements. We were disappointed in many aspects of our stay. Although the suite was nicely decorated and the staff were generally friendly, we found the concierge to be quite rude and unhelpful. It was the type of rudeness that you always hear associated with visiting Paris, but we thought it was ironic that the only place we experienced it was in a five-star hotel. That was our biggest disappointment, since we were specifically hoping for some assistance from the concierge. In addition, there were constant little problems that we didn't expect in a hotel of this caliber. The internet service available in the rooms utilized the TV, and it was complicated to use. In addition, the screen size seemed off, so you were always trying to scroll around in an awkward way to see the necessary part of the web page. It was expensive, too. I didn't sleep very well, because there was a lot of hallway noise that carried into the rooms, and because the beds were overly firm/hard (in my opinion). There were no chains on the inside of the doors, and the locks unlocked when you turned the handle -- as a result, my two-year old could open them from the inside, which meant he tried to do that about every 5 minutes (!) When we talked to the staff about it, they were unable to offer any suggestions of how to address the problem. When room service delivered food to our two-room suite, they never came to the room we requested, so they would ring the bell on the other side and often wake our 2-year old son up when he was still sleeping in the morning or during his afternoon nap. On another occasion, my husband needed to have a pair of pants cleaned, and asked them to be returned the following morning. When there was still no sign of the pants by the following afternoon, we called to track them down. They were delivered to our room ultimately, but we were still charged for the rush cleaning service on our hotel bill. To be fair, after we pointed out the error, they did remove the rush charge. On our last day, the cleaning staff accidentally threw out some fruit we had bought for our son for the plane trip the next day. I called the front desk and they offered to replace it, but didn't follow through. I had to call and ask a second time that night before they replaced it. Lastly, when I asked the concierge to point out the closest entrance to the Louvre on my map, he did so, but failed to inform me that the museum is closed on Tuesdays. I figured that out myself after making the 20-minute trek over there. Although many of these are small things, it seemed to be one long list of problems, especially since we were only there 2 nights. I would not stay there again, nor would I recommend it. For the money, you could do a lot better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat!”
Reviews.Author: MIG2006
Reviews.Content: For our 10th Wedding Anniversary, I wanted to "push the boat out", which meant limiting my choice of Paris Hotel to The Ritz, George V, etc. The thing which differentiated Hotel de Crillon - and appealed to me - was its history. Ratewise, all the top Paris hotels are spookily similar, so once you know your budget and can reconcile the price, book it and enjoy it! Incidentally, I contacted the said hotels (and a couple of others) directly by email, and Hotel de Crillon were by far the most responsive and professional. The hotel - location is very hard to beat. I think this was our 14th trip to Paris (from backpacking up to present day) and the locations we've stayed would form a scatter diagram of central Paris (left and right bank). Each area has its own distinctive feel, but Hotel de Crillon is perfect, regardless of how you pace your viist. Concorde Metro is literally at the front door, and Tuileries/Champs Elysees/Louvre/Seine/L'Orangerie all very pleasant walking distances (in fact a nice loop). The room - amazing! Very large, beautifully appointed. Overlooking Boissy d’Anglas, so quiet, yet atmospheric. The service - could not fault it. Very friendly, attentive, professional. Certainly not snobby, overbearing or excessive. Breakfast - just book breakfast as part of your rate. We opted to have breakfast in the restaurant (not just any restaurant!) rather than in-room Continental. The room is beautiful, service spot on, and a good selection (though the hot options were surprisingly limited). You can always go to a Cafe/Brasserie later in the day! In summary, there are more economical options, but for a very special occasion, I'd find it difficult to choose anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: midwestern_wanderer
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel in late October and found this hotel on the Five Star Alliance hotel website. The hotel is truly beautiful, outside and inside the lobby. Our room was ok. We booked a deluxe room a week before so were not expecting anything overlyt spectacular. The room was decent, quiet and faced the inside courtyard. I was very impressed at how housekeeping left the room so tidy and hung all our clothes each day - which was quite pleasant after coming home from a long day. Some have mentioned how expensive the breakfast is at this hotel, so I was sure to book a room with it included. I'm glad I did, because it was not to be missed. The dining room is magnificent with a lot of delicious breads, fruits, meats, and cheeses from which to choose. I must mention the hotel lounge piano bar. Yes, we were in Paris, but each night we just couldn't resist popping in for a martini. We were so impressed by the quality of liquor (DO order a dry martini with their Kaufman single estate vodka - the best vodka these lips have ever tasted) and talent of the bartenders. I do remember the concierge being rather snobish to the point where I no longer wanted to ask for his help. He seemed to appear like he couldn't be bothered with our inquiries - so we ventured out on our own. Oh yes, and the location. We walked everywhere. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “One of the great grand hotels of the world”
Reviews.Author: artydim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Crillon for 3 nights in January and highly recommend it to anyone willing to pay the price! Room: Spacious and beautiful however the old timber flooring means that you can hear people walking above. We complained of noise soon after we arrived and were instantly moved to a larger room facing the internal courtyard. The 2 rooms were different in decor but both were tastefully decorated in an opulent french style. Bathroom: Beautiful marble bathrooms, occasionally with separate toilet. Room Service: Sit down before you read the room service menu, the cheapest item is the spaghetti bologanise at 28 euro!!! Of course caviar will set you back 1000 euros, and just in case you are tempted to take the PAPER room service menu home to amuse your friends, you will be charged 60 euros!! I suppose the thinking is that if you can afford the 600 euro nightly fee then the extras should be ok, but i think they were excessive. Internet was around 12 euros for half an hour... etc ... Breakfast: served in what is rated as one of Paris' most beautiful dining rooms so since it is included in the room rate anyway, it would be disappointing to miss. The breakfast is excellent, I know croissants are meant to be fantastic in Paris, but they are really exceptional here! Tea area: in the foyer and just outside the dining room, is a beautiful room for tea or cocktails which is really worth while, make sure you find the time to enjoy it. Overall, we had a great stay enjoying old world hotel service far superior to many of the hip hotels founds in other cities such as New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: traveller55555
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Crillon has probably the best location in the town, on absolutely gorgeous Place de la Concorde, from where everything - Opera, Notre Dame, Champs Elysees, Louvre, Madeleine, luxury boutiques and department stores and even the Tour Eiffel - are in walking distance. The historical decor of the hotel is extremly beautiful and the rooms are luxurious, spacious and really nice. Bathroom amenities were from Annick Goutal. Staff is very friendly and helpful, breakfast was excellent and also the bar with a piano player was wonderful. Of course it is expensive, but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Easy on the eyes but hard on the wallet”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crillon for three days in December. The hotel is a classy establishment -- it emodies Parisian luxury, elegance and refinement, and is in the heart of the city's most exclusive shopping district (Chanel, Hermes, Bacharat and all manner of gourmet food shops are right up the street). I received a special rate, so my room overlooked an inner courtyard, but I liked it because it was quiet, and the bed was large and comfortable. The Crillon is not a bargain under any circumstances, however, especially if you are on the losing side of the weakening dollar. The continental breakfast will set you back $40 dollars; coffee or water is around $10. The neighborhood cafes are expensive too, though not as bad. The Crillon attracts a high brow clientale, and can be a bit intimidating -- there are security guards right inside the revolving door and most guests look the part-- expensively dressed and laden with shopping bags. So it is important to feel comfortable in this type of environment regardless of the size of your bank account. In sum, lovely hotel, but at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Go on - spoil yourself”
Reviews.Author: World_Shopper1
Reviews.Content: Expensive? Yes Snobbish? No Sumptuous? Most definitely! We spent a long weekend at Le Crillon at the end of September and I couldn't recommend this marble-stuffed jewel of a hotel highly enough. OK the decor is completely over the top but what do you expect? The service is faultless, everyone was friendly and the room was great, with huge comfortable bed and long french windows which opened onto the courtyard. It's expensive but worth every penny. I used to live in Paris and always promised myself that one day I'd come back and stay in this, the grandest of 'grandes dames' and I wasn't disappointed in any way. Do it - you know you want to!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Clefsdorsf
Reviews.Content: For my partners first trip to Paris--I reserved four nights at the Hotel de Crillon. With the most ideal location--on the Place de la Concorde, I knew this would make the most of our short stay. The hotel seems a bit daunting and formal at first--but once inside the staff was very kind and friendly. We had a beautiful Deluxe Room that looked out onto the historic courtyard. The room had high ceilings, elegant fixtures and lighting, a walk in closet and lavish marble bath. The Concierges were outstanding in making reservations for us at the finest restaurants and we were always given excellent tables. The dining outlets at the hotel were superb as was the very popular bar. We visited several of the other "palace" hotels in Paris, but were glad that we had chosen the Crillon. As a side note-- we did not wear denim or casual attire at all in Paris--and we received better treatment and service because of this.
